Reviews.Title: “Excellent, beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cable_consultant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of downtown Seattle, very close to Pike's Market, a very nice indoor mall, restaurants, and a Light Link Rail stop. Beautiful floor-to-ceiling wood walls, updated rooms, and gourmet food. And the Fitness Center was a home run! It's a really fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: islandjenn
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite place to stay in Seattle! They are consistent in excellent customer service, beautiful rooms, and convenienty located. I love getting a corner room as they have sweeping views of the city. Definitely stay here if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: SleeplessMom12
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Seattle is a beautiful property within a few short blocks of Pike's Place Market, West Lake Center, and so much more. The vallet parking is nice - our car was whisked away upon checkin and brought back to us when we checked out the next morning - no need to worry about parking downtown or theft or vandalism. The bellhop service was great - he unpacked our car, brought our cart up to our room, unloaded our luggage from the cart, hung up our coats, put our shoes in the closet, and showed us the tricks and treats of the room! There's a programmable safe in the closet, automatic window darkening shades at the press of a button, a door bell, and a snack bar & mini fridge (but everything is overpriced and the fridge is on sensors so if you even lift a $4 can of soda from the track, you pay for it!). The bathroom is huge with separate tub and shower, but the tub doesn't have jets. The lighting in the bathroom sucks though! I had to take a hand mirror to the window in the morning to get some daylight to put on my make-up. The dim, yellow light in the bathroom was disappointing. The bath amenitites are nice - good quality shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. There is even a real hairdryer for your convenience - not one of those mini ones hooked to the wall - but a real one! There is also an iron and ironing board in the closet if you should need it. Oh - and the coffee and tea is nice in the room - in the maker you can either run hot water through it for the tea or use the pre-packaged coffee trays to brew a cup. The bed was not very comfortable. Neither my husband or I slept well. The pillows are those horrible overstuffed down filled ones that are either too high or you sink down to the mattress. Save your neck - bring your favorite pillow from home! We didn't have time to use the hot tub...and note, there is not a pool at this hotel. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse in the hotel was nice for visiting with friends in the lounge area. We didn't eat there, just had drinks. There is a Starbuck's in the hotel too, so that's nice for breakfast! The hotel was very clean and we would stay here again. I only gave a "very good" rating because of the lack of pool, the horrible pillows and not very comfortable bed, the bad bathroom lighting, and the lack of jets in the bathtub. Everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Older style in a very traditional setup”
Reviews.Author: oscar888_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in an older building with some old facilities with very traditional looking rooms, I could not find why I did not feel at home during my stay but now I know, there is NO ambience here.

Reviews.Title: “I love Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: Janice M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location! RIght at the intersection of 7th and Pine, it is a quick and plesant walk down the Pikes market, only a block away from Pacific Place, and 2 blocks away from Nordstroms. There is tons of other shopping in the area as well which is great. As far as the actual hotel, everything about the room was perfect. We stayed here for a couple nights in July and didn't have any issues. I especially loved that the window coverings were thick enough that no light got through. For breakfast, the only option they have is Ruths Chris Steakhouse, which is good and bad. Good cause it is insanely delicious and those chocolate chip pancakes they served me were to die for, but bad because it was quite expensive and it would have been nice to have a cheaper alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kroberts5182
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fabulous stay at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle. Everyone from the door attendant to the front end receptionist was nothing but professional. The room was beyond our expectations, with the view amazing. Will stay here again, and highly recommend this ten-plus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Comfort in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kctraveler21
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a wonderful place to stay in downtown Seattle, with beautiful surroundings and friendly, professional staff. The architecture of the building and the interior design of the public spaces and private rooms is modern/ Craftsman-inspired, using natural materials such as stone and wood. The entry and lobby areas are quite grand, with tall ceilings and dramatic lighting, yet manage to be welcoming at the same time-- plenty of places to sit and talk or enjoy a coffee from the on-site Starbucks. The hotel rooms are spacious and thoughtfully designed, with handsome wood cabinetry, plenty of seating, and a great bed. Luxury bathroom with deep tub, fantastic shower, granite counter--immaculately clean. The hotel is located right in the heart of downtown--we parked our car and walked everywhere--Pike Place Market, shopping, dining, Pioneer Square. And did I mention the great staff? Definitely recommend this place, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Business Stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Robby_Thomas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a company event that was hosted in the same hotel. It is definitely a great place to stay while travelling on business/pleasure. The staff were very friendly, and the rooms and facilities were excellent. It is also conveniently located in the heart of the downtown. The attached restaurant though ( cant remember its name ) can improve its act a bit, as they were a bit clumsy on orders on more than one occasion, but nothing very bad. I didnt get a chance to checkout any of the other facilities though as my week there was packed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the Conv. Ctr”
Reviews.Author: biotechwriter
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many Hyatt hotels for business travel, when it came to choosing what brand of hotel to select in Seattle, that was easy. However, if you search the downtown area by the convention center for Hyatt you will see 2 listings. This one is the Grand Hyatt and I consider it to be a much more traditional hotel. The other option is the Olive 8 which was listed as a boutique hotel and I feared overly modern and cold dÃ©cor (not what I am looking for when traveling for work). Note that the Grand does not have a Hyatt branded restaurant, their lobby restaurant is a Ruthâ€™s Chris Steakhouse ($$$$). It also does not have a lobby bar â€“ this was not a problem for me as I never use this option. Their was a Hyatt restaurant at the Olive 8 as well as a Spa and pool. I visited the gym and it was nicer than I expected! Many cardio machines, weight machines, wet sauna/Jacuzzi, locker rooms and massage rooms. The staff was incredibly friendly (with one exception â€“ my checkout front desk person was quite short with me and bordered on rude, but I was half asleep so some of my opinion may have been colored by that). I had access to the Grand Club (formerly the Regency Club) and the staff there was over-the-top friendly and helpful. I was checked in by Lily who was an exemplar of welcoming warm friendliness. The room was standard, mini-bar, flat screen, desk etc. I was upgraded to the hypoallergenic room which included a HEPA air filter. My chief complaint as it is with almost all hotelsâ€¦not enough outlets and what few there are can be hard to reach. The bathroom was spectacular!!! Deep tub, shower stall, large vanity, robes and plenty of towels! The location would also be appropriate if you were looking to be â€œuphillâ€� from the market and other downtown attractions (SAM, ferries, Theaters). It is also very close to Pacific Place and all the great shopping that can be found in downtown Seattle. I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Grand Hyatt and one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: I have top status with Hyatt and consistently I am upgraded to a large room or often a suite. If you have access to the club room try for the 27th floor where it is located because you can step down the hall for water or food to take back to your room. It is centrally located, staff with a good attitude and their club room offers excellent food for its Gold Passport members. I always enjoy the club room and the hotel rooms. The bathrooms are huge and nicely done. My only problem is that their only restaurant in the hotel is a Ruth Chris and their menu is old and stale to me. There is a Cheescake Factory behind the hotel which is very good but always busy. Even at 9pm and in the middle of the week.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: divelovers
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference for 4 days. The room was ideal for what I needed. The upgrade to a suite allowed for business to take place in my room without a bed in the middle. The bathroom was fantastic as noted by others. I enjoyed the fitness area, although a little confined relative to the size of the hotel and the fitness-minded Seattle population. The cab ride isn't bad and is under $50. I had colleagues that did the train for much less money and minimal trouble. Walking distance to great restaurants and the riverfront made the location very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Lolapalooza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights and had a really good experience. We had a nightmare journey to get there and ended up arriving over 5 hours late but when we called them to make sure they weren't going to give our rooms away (that had happened to us with a different hotel on a previous occasion) they just told us not to worry and were very helpful. The check-in team, porters, valet guys and room service team were all really fantastic and helpful during our stay. The rooms are a good size and nicely furnished although could do with a light refurb as some of the furniture is getting a bit tatty. The desk is a good size to work from and the wired internet connection was reliable. All rooms have a minibar, laptop-size safe, iron and ironing board as standard but it's the bathroom that really made the difference for me. The bathroom was huge with a lovely deep tub and a separate oversized shower that you could really move around in...sadly lacking from most hotels. My only issue was sleep quality...all the bedroom doors really slam hard when they shut which did wake me up on a few occasions, and also the walls are so thin that I got woken up by next doors alarm going off. Overall though I really enjoyed my stay here and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Kane K
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. Service was great. Got a great price by searching the net. Great location. Room was great. Breakfast was free and what you would expect from a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: grandmaB47
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, clean, with a comfortable king-sized bed. The bathroom is very large with separate shower and tub. The hotel does not have a gift shop which seemed odd for a fancy hotel like this; however, there is a small deli/market on the premises as well as a Starbucks. I had to pay $7.95 for a few minutes of Internet service in the business center. Easy walking access to the convention center. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: soviatt09
Reviews.Content: I found the free breakfast on the grand level could have offered more. But overall the hotel room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with only minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: PlazMan
Reviews.Content: I found the Grand Hyatt in Seattle to be a great choice for my one-night stay since I needed to attend an event at the Paramount Theatre, just a block away. The check-in staff was very friendly and efficient and had me on my way up to my room in short order. Off-street parking is convenient, though a bit pricey, with a parking garage located right behind the hotel. The rooms, while not large, are very comfortable. Much of the space was taken up by the bathroom which had an enormous shower plus a separate tub and expansive counter and sink. It seemed luxurious until I tried out the towels, which appeared to be made for a middle tier fitness club rather than a top notch hotel. The room was very quiet; I didn't notice any noise from adjoining rooms or the hallway, although I didn't see many people on my floor so I'm sure that helped. There were some other very nice touches such as electrically controlled window shade to block out the downtown lights and a lighted closet for hanging clothes. The king bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows to choose from. Besides the disappointing towels, the thing which made this less than a perfect night's stay was the WiFi connection. I'm always amazed that Holiday Inn Express can provide me with rock-solid WiFi for free, but a place like the Hyatt will charge at least $10 per night for flaky internet access. I even splurged for the "Premium" WiFi at $15 per night, and found it to be painfully slow. I gave up trying to get work done from my room and switched over to using my phone for basic web access. Overall, my stay at the Grand Hyatt was a very good experience, and I would probably stay here again on my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: emcgoo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights the Hyatt Grand Seattle in January for a mini-vacation. We got a great deal on the Hyatt website. The cost of our room included breakfast and access to the Grand Club. Our room was on the 25th floor and had an amazing view of the city and water. Although the room was a little on the small side, it was nice and the bathroom was great. The hotel was very quiet and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: frye45
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for anything more, great hotel and location. They even upgraded us to a nice suite for no additional costs. Would stay at again in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...a little trouble with the linens...could use some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: idahofan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference. Overall, our experience was very positive. We stayed in a Grand Club level room, and our views were breathtaking. The breakfasts and snacks served in the Grand Club Lounge were wonderful, and the hostess there was outstanding, very helpful and pleasant! Our only complaint was the mattress pad on our king bed kept coming up in the middle of the night. Someone from guest services was there immediately on the first night to help remedy the problem, but the only solution was to install the same, cheap, ineffective mattress pad style, too small to stay on a deeper mattress. Because the bottom sheets were not fitted, there was no way prevent the inevitable waking up in the middle of the night laying directly on the mattress. Gross! It was a frustrating 6- night stay for that reason alone. The hotel should look into purchasing better quality mattress pads.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laweber28
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference, and enjoyed that hotel. Close to everything, friendly staff. Beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with all the amenities.”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCorky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in the week between Christmas and New Year's while on a shopping trip with a friend. Thought the rooms and amenities were terrific and the adjoining restaurant was exceptional. Proximity to shopping, Pike Place Market and other attractions made it an ideal place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: parisvoyagista
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, lovely room with all the amenities (a radio/ipod doc - why aren't these in all nice hotel rooms??), great location. Would highly recommend. The Hyatt may be our new go-to hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bfree82
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Our room was super clean, comfy, and had a beautiful view. The staff was very helpful and always polite and friendly. Excellent location. We had a great experience and would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern space; comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: FirstMate
Reviews.Content: Minimalist lobby gives way to sleek and clean rooms with very comfortable beds. Was in Room 2024. Arrived at night and was pleasantly surprised to awake to a view of the Space Needle. Starbucks in lobby was quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay if you are in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller23_11
Reviews.Content: Good hotel; corner suite very good. Modern, clean. No issues. Very good gym and facilities. Stay here when in Seattle. Very good experience and I have stayed here several times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: acmorris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the NYE weekend, and we liked this hotel! Pros: * Quiet rooms. We upgraded to a corner on the 17th floor, and the bedroom is very quiet. * Almost-new rooms. As you can see in the photos, the condition of our room was excellent. * Good service - everyone we interacted with (check-in, check-out, other folks we talked with, etc) was very courteous and helpful. * Location - we arrived very late our first night, and didn't feel the least bit unsafe. Just a few blocks from the market and downtown. Cons: * Dining is a bit limited. There's Ruth's Chris and Starbucks (or in-room dining, priced like Ruth's Chris), but no breakfast buffet or hotel restaurant. (The spectrum is wide, but not a lot in the middle.) But that's about it. Overall, we liked this place. We'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: ZaiZaiLv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for Christmas. Used the Hyatt points, but looking at the price listed, it is very reasonable, especially for such a great location and amenities. Customer Service: I have been a member of Hyatt for years, and I must say, I have never been as impressed by the customer service as at the Grand Hyatt Seattle. Normally, at more corporate hotel like this, you receive the more courteous type of customer service, more like "I'm doing this because I have to, not because I want to". But here, everyone is very friendly and seems generally happy to help. We were also greeted by our names, which hardly ever happens anymore in this type of hotel. In fact, after our stay, the Mr actually called the hotel to find out where they got their salmon served at the Grand Club was from and they actually contacted him back w/ the information. It was a simple gesture, but I have contacted other hotel to find information on something they served during our previous stay, and was ignored even though they're known for their excellent customer service. Room: We had a gorgeous view of the water from our room. The room itself is not too big, but not too small; very comfortable size for a hotel room. The bathroom however is not the typical Hyatt bathroom. It reminds me more of the Vegas hotels bathroom (think Bellagio, Wynn, etc). Loved the soak tub, and my request for bath salt was accommodated without any problems, although I am still confused as to why hotels w/ tubs don't provide bath salt/soap for this purpose without having to request it. You can't exactly use regular shower gel to take a bath. The bed is typical Hyatt bed, comfortable enough. However, the pillows are so flat we had to fluff them up by sleeping on two (three for me). I don't understand why hotels spend so much money on every other aspect of their hotels, except for the pillows. You spend most of your time on top of them, comfort is necessity! Location: you know what that say, location location location. Walking distance to pretty much everything. Granted Seattle is not that big and easily accessible, but this location is located in a perfect spot for tourists. You are literarily smacked in the middle of the shopping area when you walk out of the hotel, and just a short few blocks walk to Pike Place. It's only 1 or 2 block walk to the bus stop so hopping in and out of busses is not a problem at all. Fitness Center: I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the fitness center. Plenty of machines and selections. Minor incident which really wasn't the hotel's fault. Perhaps they should put up a big giant sign before the door to the hot tub area instead of the corner so everyone could see that proper attires are required to enter the area. Sure, it should be common knowledge that this area is coed, but apparently it is not common knowledge at all. We had the unpleasant incident w/ three women who let's just say not dressed for a coed area. It was uncomfortable for all, but especially for the Mr whose hot tubbing time was cut short w/ this incident. Grand Club: Okay, I've heard a lot of complaints about their Grand Club from another travel forum, so I wasn't expecting a lot. Sockeye salmon they served in the morning is the Mr's favorite (thus the calling the hotel for info on it). They don't serve hot food for breakfast, but honestly, I quite enjoy grabbing something quick here and having breakfast/lunch/brunch elsewhere later on. A lot of time, the breakfast served at the hotel isn't exactly the best quality anyway. The afternoon snack consists of hot appetizers, veggies and dips, and drinks. Not a lot of selections, but good enough for snacking purposes. Alcohol is extra, which we weren't aware of *not that it'd stop us from ordering, but it'd be nice if there's a sign to indicate that* (the last day, the magic sign was there; perhaps someone complained?). I must disclose that we had free access to the Grand Club because of my status. Not sure if I'd pay extra for it honestly. The view from the club was beautiful and the room was comfortable to hang out in, however, the food selection isn't worth how much you'd have to pay for. But since it's free for us, I can't complain much. In conclusion, we had a great stay, and we will definitely consider the Grand Hyatt next time we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tila97
Reviews.Content: stayed here xmas and nye 2011. loved it. we had suite on 28th floor overlooking awesome views. brill staff. food service was great. clean sheets and very tidy rooms. would stay here again. love it in winter times. so pretty.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time in seattle”
Reviews.Author: acribari
Reviews.Content: spent just 2 nights. got great rate b/c slow period between christmas and NYE. good location. anyone we interacted w at the property was very friendly. had corner room on high floor w/ good view. comfy bed. little things: single sheet toilet paper, crudy little plastic garbage cans, one cup serving in-room coffee machines and enough lotion for 1/2 of one body is sort of irritating in a Hyatt Grand. (but it was the same at the Grand Hyatt Waikiki a few months ago so that's a Hyatt ding, not particular to this location, I guess)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOSeattle
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is in a great location in Seattle. It is close to theaters, shopping and within a mile of Pike Place Market. My intention was to find a quiet and comfortable location to get some work done. Staying on the 24th floor, I had a great view and comfortable chair to work in and a lovely room. Marble bathroom, big comfortable tub as well as separate shower. My only complaint would be that they charge for internet access which is ridiculous when you consider that I could go downstairs to the Starbucks in the clobby and use it for the cost of a cup of coffee. Overall, lovely hotel, beautiful interiors, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a dozen times over the past year and have never had an issue. Extremely clean rooms and helpful staff make this one of the best places I have ever stayed. If you partake - Ruth Chris Steak House in in the hotel. Happy Hour is a great value and plenty of people to keep you from getting bored.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hyatt Property with one bummer”
Reviews.Author: DougDilvo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my bride as we took in the Pre-Christmas activities downtown. Hotel offered a "shopping package" for 199. The rate included 75 in gift cards to local retailers, free valet parking and an in room movie....A great deal, considering it drops the rate for the hotel room to under 100 easily. We booked a King Room, but did the Hyatt upgrade option that is available when you book a room. Ended up getting the upgrade to the Grand club floors and to an Executive suite The upgrade was well worth it. Executive suite had a separate sitting room with TV and wet bar, and single bath, and through french doors that lead to the bedroom. Standard work station (that lacked AC plug in on desk), and a gigantic closet and bathroom. Bathroom had separate toilet area, huge shower and gigantic soaking tub. Great amenities to spoil yourself with. Loved the room and and push button darkening blinds. Was glad we upgraded to the grand club floors as it provided complimentary evening snacks and reasonably priced adult beverages (5 bucks), plus a great morning breakfast spread. The club is open all day with coffee, soda and water and the folks working in it are awesome. Did not use the health club but took a look. Great set up plus a nice whirl pool. Images on web site are accurate, keep in mind that there is not a pool at this property. Check in, check out and Valet were flawless. Great public area staff that were spot on and did a great job. The only downer on the trip is related to the work station in the bedroom. It did not have plug ins on top of the desk, so was forced to plug two I-phone chargers into the wall outlet under the desk. We left the chargers by mistake and didn't realize to later in the evening after we checked out. I called the hotel and asked if they had found them. Was told that house keeping did not report any found items from the room, but that security would take a look in the room as it was vacant that evening. NO luck as they said the room was clean. That leaves only a few options. House keeping threw them in the trash, House Keeping put them in their pocket, or the hotel does not have a good lost and found tracking system. What makes it even more of a bummer is that we tip well and did so for the house keeping staff as we always do. This is totally our fault for leaving the chargers in the room, but I was hopeful based off our great experience during our stay that they would be located. Don't let this sour your thoughts of staying here, as we will certainly consider coming back to this property. We have stayed at 8 downtown 4 star + properties in Seattle and this is one of the best, just wish they could have found our I phone chargers.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you're staying downtown.”
Reviews.Author: NicollFamily
Reviews.Content: If you're staying downtown, location is excellent. Within 3 to blocks of the best of downtown shopping. Convention center? Right next door. Obviously renovated in the not too distant past, so rooms are in excellent shape with all the amenities you would expect for this price range, such as large bathroom with separate marble shower, excellent bed and recently updated furnishings. As you would expect from any Downtown hotel, this is oriented to business travellers. If you're looking for the romantic weekend getaway, however, there may be better options (Fairmont?). I gave it a 4 overall for service. Nice furnishings and updating are important, but really great hotels distinguish themselves with the calibre of their service, and that usually means the training of their employees. As a rule, on this point Hyatt is fine, but not great. And this hotel is no exception to that rule. One word of caution - downtown is a little edgy at night for my liking. The people we encountered while walking around looking for our restaurant at 9 pm did definitely make us a little unconfortable at times. My wife will want to stay in Bellevue on the next weekend trip to Seattle, because of that. But that is obviously something that is a very personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: Shuman415
Reviews.Content: Just a quick post. Had the best time, Stayed on the 28th floor in suite. Great employees. View was great. food great. I cant wait to get back...

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Castle_Rock
Reviews.Content: I am normally a diehard Marriott guy but stayed in this hotel for business reasons and was pleasantly surprised. Hyatt calls this a luxury hotel and I agree. The hotel has a huge beautiful lobby that sets the tone of the place. I paid a little extra for a view room and Grand Club Lounge access and boy was it worth it. My room was very nice with a beautiful view of downtown, Pine Street and the water. I loved watching the ferries come and go. The Grand Club Lounge is easily one of the best I have ever seen. Very high end spread in the morning and evening with coffee, sodas and water all day long. The Hotel is right next to the convention center and short walking distance to tons of shopping, restaurants and the Pike Place Market. Everything in downtown is close and easy to get to. If you are going to stay in downtown donâ€™t bother to rent a car. Just get a taxi to and from the airport and save the hassle and cost of parking. Restaurant service is from the attached Ruth Chris. Good food but not cheap. There are tons of restaurants in every price range close by and all over downtown if you donâ€™t want to eat there. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was modern and immaculate with a huge bathroom. My only small gripe is the single power outlet at the desk. In order to plug my laptop and phone charger in I had to unplug the desk lamp. You pay a little more for this place but I feel you get what you paid for. I will definitely come back to this hotel. Tips: Ask for a high floor with a view. The Roosevelt hotel is right next to the Hyatt and could block a water view if you are on a lower floor. Make sure you are above it. The Grand Club Lounge is well worth the extra money. Terrific high end spread in the morning and evening with very reasonably priced wine & liquor during happy hour. It has great views and is a very comfortable place to hang out. I have seen many lounges and this was easily one of the best. Bring a power strip if you plan to work at the desk. My room only had one outlet available at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “There are other hotels near by with friendlier staff”
Reviews.Author: ctus
Reviews.Content: Not nearly the quality of stay you'd expect for a Hyatt. Manager and staff and rude, and obviously dont value the guests. My advise is go stay at the Hilton or Roosevelt. Same quality hotels, but with much better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: citygirl36
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is my favorite in Seattle - gorgeous rooms with nice views, perfect location and great staff. Room rate is unfortunately too high for corporate travel budget nowadays, but for those able to spend a little more for the kind of luxury this Hyatt offers, I'd say it's worth it, particularly for special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: marspice
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline for $100 on the Saturday of the Black Friday weekend. Pulled up to the hotel and checked in and was asked if we wanted valet or self-park. We did self-park,but probably should have chosen valet. The self park is deep in the building with low ceilings. It cost $30 for 24hrs, we paid $38 as we stayed 25hours. I would assume valet is the same price? Helpful bellboy took our luggage to the room, although a tad-unprofessional with his jokes, was very friendly. Love the "electronic" black-out blinds. The room we had on the 20th floor was gorgeous.... the decor was very modern and the room had alot of wood in it. The bathroom was HUGE, separate shower and tub, even toothpaste was included, nice bonus. Only one robe though, thought that was kinda of weird for a room for two people. There was an umbrella to use in the room, along with a pricey (of course!) censored mini-bar. Electronic "do not disturb" button. The hotel doesn't have a pool,but apparently has a hot tub and sauna. There is a Starbucks, store/deli, and Sushi restaurant on site. Free wifi only at Starbucks, otherwise it's $10 up to $15 a day in your room. The location is great! Walking distance to a great sports pub "Fox News Sports Bar" -- all the refs from the Washington Huskies game were there when we there. Close to a nightclub called Pink -- top 40. Huge 2-story American Eagle just down the block and a couple movie theatres within 2 blocks. And of course not too far from the Pier, about 15 min walk or so. We caught the bus from 3rd and Pine to Century Link stadium where the Seahawks played. It was free (???) not sure why. Free both ways! Otherwise it should have been $2.25. This is a great hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. We slept so good because of the electronic black-out blinds and comfy bed we almost missed our Seahawks game!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: PitBullLover_84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, the rooms are spacious and the beds are comfy. The bathroom is nice and and a good size tub. The staff were nice and efficient. We were out enjoying seattle most of the time but enjoyed our time in our room. The best part was the blackout blinds that you can put down- its easy to sleep into the afternoon with these. There is apprently a doorbell with each of the rooms..we were a little confused at the ringing in our room and it turned out to be housekeeping. We got a great deal on the room and would probably stay again; would like to try something a little closer to the water next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SRyding
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Stylish, classy and luxurious. Would highly recommend staying here if you are visiting Seattle - well located, friendly staff and beautiful fit out.

Reviews.Title: “They remembered my name...”
Reviews.Author: DanCinJo
Reviews.Content: We had received a free night at the Hyatt with our credit card and reserved a room. It was a marvelous experience. They upgraded us to a king size bed and beautiful view of the harbor on the 27th floor. It was a "grand" experience - and when we left the next day - the staff remembered our name from the night before. Unbelievable. Wish I had another voucher - I wouldn't hesitate staying with this classy company.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: AussieJools
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The foyer is stylish and classy. The bell-person took us to our room, explained all the features of the room AND the hotel and also suggested places to eat and see. The best room feature was the automatic black out blinds which darken the room perfectly for sleeping. It was rainy during our stay and we were provided with an umbrella to use. I loved the fact that there was a Starbucks in the hotel as well as a small store providing all needs including wine! The gym was fantastic as well as the hot tub, steam room and sauna. Very high end. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a break from reality and feeling spoiled for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tico107
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located close to the Key Arena in a decent neighbourhood. Walking distance to the water and the acitivties down there. The room was large with a sitting area to watch tv, a little desk/space for doing work and a comfy king size bed with lots of godo quality pillows. Attention to detail was great with toothpaste provided plus a throw blanket to use while watching tv. Lots of choices at breakfast with juice and coffee/tea.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaLee011
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Seattle was amazing! The Grand Hyatt added to the wonderful experience. The room amenities were what made the trip...the room was so comfortable...and, the separate deep tub and shower were wonderful! Our view was just okay. But, we were so close to everything that we didn't spend that much time looking out the window. The 5pm reception each evening on the conceirge level each evening had amazing appetizers, and, the continental breakfast each morning...smoked salmon, bagels, fresh fruit..wonderful! The staff there were all so nice...we were there almost a week...so they became like family! The hotel was conveniently located to many wonderful restaurants, Pike Place Market, the Space Needle. Close to the ferries, too. If you like Asian food....Dragonfish...just across the street was really good! And, for bagels and coffee...CafeLadro was on the corner. Would definitely stay there again...hopefully I will have the chance really soon.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSV3534
Reviews.Content: Before our stay at the Grand Hyatt, we were in Vancouver. While there we stayed at a fabulous new hotel. We have stayed at the Grand Hyatt here a few times, but because the hotel in Vancouver was so nice it made the Grand Hyatt seem like an average Hotel to my husband and I. While it is clean enough and I think well-run, there is nothing special about this hotel. I think the next time I am in Seattle I will try something different, maybe a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay for awesome price”
Reviews.Author: samm_8608
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hyatt back in July (been meaning to write this review sooner!) We were in Seattle for the long weekend and just wanted to get away somewhere that we could drive to. That being said we weren't expecting a whole lot. Especially when my boyfriend used priceline to bid. We were pleasantly surprised when we got the hyatt for the price we asked for. The hotel was so much more than we could have asked for. The room was a nice size with a comfortable king size bed. The view from our room wasn't great but that really just depends on what side of the hotel you're put on. The bathroom is huge, nice big glass shower and a large separate bathtub, double sinks as well. And the room was spotless both days we were there. The location is right in the downtown shopping area and not to far from the farmers market. Valet parking was quick and all the stuff we encountered were always smiling and happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: LUVSASKATCHEWAN
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge and excellent and the young man how delivered our luggage gave us an overview of the amenities in the room (where the button was to lower the blinds, where the button was for do not distrub). The breakfast staff in Ruth's Chris were great. Where the hotel was a major let down was the concierge service. Only ever one person working at the desk, so be prepared to wait to have your questions answered and then not always helpful. The Yelp application on my phone was way better. One example- asked about the underground tour and was told there was no need for reservations, so we walked over only to be told that the next two tours were sold out (they run on the hour) and to see their was a will call where people could pick up their pre-ordered tickets. The concierge at the Hyatt Olive 8 for our first night in Seattle was much better.

Reviews.Title: “not what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: arep
Reviews.Content: the night before staying in Seattle we stayed at the Comfort inn at Tacoma, surprisingly nice. Thought we would splurge and stay in style at the Grand Hyatt, no doubt a better room, the bathroom was huge! nice staff, clean, clean, clean. it was close but failed at some small points that we think should not be at issue. crappy in room cable, and pay for WiFi? When you pay allot small things stand out. always liked Hyatt before. we had a great time in Seattle. Maybe if they offered a email checking service.

Reviews.Title: “Convient location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: smilie604
Reviews.Content: Amazing customer service always makes the difference! When making a reservation make sure you specify which type of room you would like. This makes quite a big difference as the hotel staff try to accommodate your wants!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Location in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MB500SEC
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is located right across the street from the convention center. It is also walking distance to the downtown attractions. The staff atthe Hyatt is friendly and knowledgable. They do charge extra for early check in and a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Big convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rxnroll
Reviews.Content: Nice room in a great location, but there are a lot of hotels in Downton Seattle that can say the same. Kind of a cold, sterile atmosphere. Obviously cater to conventions. Ruths Chris is always good, but the bar is not appealing. Walked in the rain to the Mayflower for a drink. Really irritates me that they charge for WI-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: boogle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over xmas, really nice staff, roomy rooms and very clean. Only fun was the fire alarm that went off but it wasn't in the middle of the night and fire escapes were clearly marked which is always a bonus. Hotel in walking distance of all the shops and attractions so i'd fully recommend it, loved Seattle and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand is right.”
Reviews.Author: drmrru12
Reviews.Content: Outstanding, friendly, helpful staff make this a special place to stay. From dining and visitor recommendations to assuring that our room was all it should be to a relaxed and professional greeting at check-in, all the staff involved with us were gracious and sincere. The room had a terrific city view, top quality furnishings and a very modern appeal--lots of granite, glass, and space, space, space. A comfortable bed was complimented by excellent bedding, complimentary gowns, and electronics that worked flawlessly. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Jim1234181718
Reviews.Content: First of all, great location. close to everything. An easy walk to the Pike Place market and lots of shopping. The stadiums are an easy walk away as well, about 20 minutes. The hotel is nice, our room was great (starting to show its age a little bit), big room, clean, bed was really comfortable. A little disapointed in the restaurant, we had an average breakfast with above average prices (dirty dishes). Didn't go back as there are tons of other restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely decorated. The room is large. The staff is helpful. The location is conveniently located just few blocks from shopping malls and westlake light rail station. It lists as 4 stars but it is definitely nicer than most 4 stars hotels.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: lindsyrox
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a room at the Grand Hyatt Seattle through priceline at a decent rate. The room was a decent size with the bathroom being the highlight with a glass wall in shower and separate deep soaking tub on the opposite side of the room. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was awesome and friendly. The hot tub was nice and a fair size and the gym was the largest I've seen in a hotel, exceptional. The location was super close to pacific place (the upscale mall) as well as westlake center and the monorail. Over all a great hotel in a great central downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hyatt properties in the US”
Reviews.Author: gktravelguru
Reviews.Content: Certainly one of the best Hyatt properties in the USA. Great convenient location. Check-in extremenly efficient. Preferences were all noted and room prepared accordingly. Great for business travelers. Rooms are spacious, very clean, well maintained. What one would expect from some of the premier Hyatt properties in Asia. Service was outstanding. Was there for one night only so did not get a chance to visit the restaurant in-house. Can be pricey unless you have a corporate rate of the hotel is running a special. but certaily worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, perfect location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: TexShelli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle for a conference. The auditorium was modern and perfectly appointed for the seminar with plenty of electrical outlets for laptops and cell phones and great lighting. Very comfortable room for long learning days. The bathrooms were outstanding--in the rooms and throughout the hotel! Great soaking tub with a separate shower and large double vanity. AWESOME! The bed was super comfy and I loved the big windows! A great addition was the electric shade that you could use to darken the room for an afternoon nap. And the chair with the ottoman--ridiculously comfortable and great for reading and watching TV. The concierge arranged a tour for me and even helped me find someone to do my hair for a special event. My hair requires a specialist so the salon was outside of downtown but they found it for me and it worked out great! Last but not least, the hotel is on the Seattle Sound train line and convenient to everything in downtown including malls, the baseball stadium, shopping, dining, the Pike Place Market and even the airport. All in all, a great hotel with a fabulous location. I will stay there anytime I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: airikeli
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite hotel in the city! So close to everything with a great sushi place in the building and a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous accommodations but watch add ons!”
Reviews.Author: auditing4you
Reviews.Content: First this hotel is grand... Location is great, Rooms are quiet and clean. Had club level suite with access to free food and drinks morning and evening! You will be able to park upon arrival and walk everywhere you wish to go! Now for the other charges! Parking 40.00 a day valet 30.00 a day self park in garage! Internet 15.00 a day and the market store has everything you wish but expensive as well! Would stay anytime again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: texasgirlandboy22
Reviews.Content: We took an Alaskan cruise on Holland America for our first anniversary and I booked a "four star" hotel in the Pike place area on Priceline...and we ended up here! The hotel has exceptional service-with the exception of the older lady concierge--I asked her two different questions and neither time did she even look up or acknowledge my existence other than to wave me off to the front desk, muttering "ask them" pointing in the direction of the front desk! The bell staff and front desk offered great service and were super helpful. The hotel itself is immaculate and I would definitely stay here again if traveling to Seattle. It's close to the market and great restaurants, all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and room!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiej36
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for ten nights. At check in I had been assigned a room with 2 doubles on a low floor, as I was travelling solo the extra bed was a waste and the very polite receptionist (I can't remember her name, but it was unusual, Rawa?) instead allocated me a king room on a high floor with a view of lake union, which was very appreciated due to my length of stay!! I loved being able to open the little window and get some fresh air into the room. The room was large, had a chair and ottoman as well as desk and chair and the large bathroom was spectacular! Loved the bath and giant glass shower (no clingly wet shower curtain here!). Water pressure in the shower was great, the bath was relaxing and a decent size. I did find that the tv while a newer flatscreen, for some reason some of the channels were very poor quality in terms of pixilating and being fuzzy (CW and the channels below), while others were in HD, and I found the number of channels very limited, considering the wide vairety offered at other hotels. Also having to pay the $9.95 daily internet fee (14.95 for faster internet, but to be honest I didn't notice a difference surfing the internet/uploading photos etc) was per device which was frustrating! Other hotels charge per room, not per device. Its annoying having to pay for internet in this day and age, especially such an amount per day, but the per device is just over the top. Customer service was impecable, in particular to the staff member that checked me in, Jocelyn at reception when I had a problem with my key, needed a fridge for my room and had a message to pick up, and Eric the bellhop. All of them provided service with a smile, that seemed genuine and not forced. It made for an enjoyable and memorable stay. The hotel is well located in downtown Seattle. Plenty of food options in the vicinity, easy walk to Pike Place Market and the monorail to Seattle centre, and lots of shopping nearby! I hope to visit Seattle again next year and I look forward to staying at the Grand Hyatt if possible, I highly reccomend the hotel for its service, beautiful large room and location.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: tmcinnis949
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Grand Hyatt every time I visit Seattle, and have never been disappointed. The rooms are updated and in great condition. The design is modern but warm, with granite, wood, and earthtones making each room feel comfortable yet sophisticated. The bathrooms are large, usually with separate shower stalls and baths. Special touches like a dimmer switch in the bathroom and blackout curtains that operate with a flip of a switch, add to the 5-star quality. Most of the rooms have great views of the Puget Sound, mountains and/or Space Needle. The location of the hotel is great. A short walk to shopping at Nordstrom's flagship store, numerous restaurants, and Pike Place Market. The hotel restarurant is Ruth's Chris, and besides the usual breakfast choices, one can enjoy the best steak and eggs you've ever had. There's a reason I keep coming back for more.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect anniversary suite”
Reviews.Author: Lifelonglibrarian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Seattle Grand Hyatt because of its proximity to the market and the monorail, both places we wanted to see. It was also in the midst of some great shopping and the Executive King Suite offered great views and great use of space. The room provided a fridge and small kitchen area, a great jacuzzi tub and even an extra powder room for the early riser. Separate sitting area from bedroom. Great stay for a great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but could be better service”
Reviews.Author: Cecebs
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this is an excellent location for a hotel in Seattle. Shopping, restaurants, the Market, and the waterfront are all within easy walking distance. If you really wanted to, you could also walk to the Seahawks' and Mariners' stadiums. It is about a mile walk, but my husband and I did do it pretty easily. Pros: - Close to everything (as already stated) - Beautiful room with a great view on higher floors. (We were on the 24th floor.) The window goes almost floor to ceiling, which I loved. And, they have fantastic curtains that go up and down at the touch of a button that block out almost ALL light. They're fantastic. Beds were very comfortable. - Starbucks is connected to it in the lobby. - Pretty friendly staff at check-in. Cons: - Parking is a ridiculous $30/day. - No free wi-fi available in the rooms. Starbucks does have it, but it is extremely inconvenient. - We had called down to the desk about our bathtub. (It wouldn't plug.) We had to call three times before someone finally came up. Those calls were once early in the morning, once again about nine hours later (at which point we were told that it would be done within in the next hour), and then once more about four hours later. Finally, someone came up. - We had issues with our parking ticket. While I realize the hotel doesn't actually run the parking garage, they are still using it for their guests as "their" parking facilities. The hotel would not help us out at all with our issue. The parking ticket became demagnetized and wouldn't work in the machines, but yet they wouldn't issue us a new one. It was a HUGE issue everything morning and evening going to and from my meetings. Not only was it an inconvenience for me, but everyone else behind me who had to wait. We would stay here again, just based on its excellent location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. No complaints here.”
Reviews.Author: Steve1811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids in a suite on the 30th floor. Had great views of the Space Needle, Pike Street below and the city with water and mountains in the distance. Might as well have been in Frasiers apartment. Very clean and up to date rooms. No noise at all. Very secure. Great, friendly service. Plenty of room for the kids although no pool. Very convenient to everything we wanted to see. 10 min walk to pike market, 2 min walk to monorail for 3 min ride to Space Needle.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room - Couch is Not a Sofabed”
Reviews.Author: CAKarenOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: I booked an Emerald Suite thinking I would have a sofabed in the sitting room and then I would order a roll-away bed for my other teen. No. The rooms in this hotel are very large, the bathroom is large - but we needed 2 roll-away beds. Overall the value of this hotel was excellent. Linens and Rooms were very nice. The Location of the hotel is an easy walk to the water, there is a Starbucks in the base of the hotel and a Ruth's Chris. Easy walk to a lot of other restaurants. There is even a Hertz within a block that will probably same you money if you book your car there instead of at the airport - if that works for you.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect hotel...Hyatt corporate could make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: jaskev
Reviews.Content: At the hotel property level, it is near perfect- one issue but that will come later. The staff could not be more accommodating or professional. The location lets you walk pretty much anywhere in the city. The market is a quick 10 minute walk and along the way you'll pass Macy's, Nordstrom's, Nordstrom's Rack about 100 other stores and about 100 Starbucks. This city loves its coffee! My one complaint with the hotel itself is that the room was stunningly made up upon our arrival with multiple pillows on the bed, everything looking fresh and new but the cleaning staff did only the bear minimum each day. The bed was made but all the decor pillows were left exactly where we deposited them the night before. Although the room was clearly cleaned, it was not "made up". Part of the hotel experience, in my opinion, is coming in to a freshly made up room after a day of sightseeing. That didn't happen. I also didn't say anything mainly because we were rushing from place to place and it just wasn't top of mind. Now...what can Hyatt corporate do? Stop nickle and diming people who are paying top dollar to be in your luxury hotel. Extra charges included WiFi (come on, Hyatt, get with the times!), a DVD player for the room and parking. Fast forward a few days and we're now in Kansas City staying at the #1 Raphael hotel in the tony Country Club Plaza area (this property is now owned by Marriott) - free Wifi, free valet parking, DVD player for the room? No problem one was immediately brought up free of charge. If I returned to Seattle, I would not hesitate to stay here again and recommend it. Fantastic property and very, very well run.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sraNc
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt has an ideal location....couple of blocks to the monorail for the Space Needle area. Easy walk to Pikes Place Market .

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel4me
Reviews.Content: You must use the workout facility! Great! Rooms are wonderful. Staff very helpful. Close to everything. You do not need a car in Seattle! Transportation is free or nominal. Take the LINK to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for business women”
Reviews.Author: vorsoni
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt in downtown Seattle has thought about everything a traveling business woman might need. From shower caps, which regular hotels are starting to forget, to the right amount of body lotion, a great shampoo+conditioner that leave your hair shiny and not all flat and lifeless like the cheap stuff other hotels usually offer, to total blackout shades. I had forgotten my hairspray and they even had this on hand, free of charge. Their blow dryer also has the fine pointy end that's needed for a good blow dry. Really they thought about everything. The bathtub is also deep enough to truly enjoy a bath at the end of a crazy day. The gym is a true gym: state of the art equipment, a sauna/jacuzzi/steam room (co-ed so bring your bathing suit). If you need a quiet room to sleep, ask for a high floor like 24 and above. Two little issues, not big enough to make them lose their 5 dot rating though :) -- the iron was leaking (room 2416) and the business center charges $7.95/15 min for access to the internet if you need to use their PC to connect to the web. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great”
Reviews.Author: snipes28
Reviews.Content: Great from the moment we arrived till the second we left. The bell Staff was awesome, Check in was friendly, Ruth Chris was awesome, Blue C Sushi was fun, The room was huge and clean, And the parking was expensive like every downtown hotel. The location is fantastic. Close to everything you could want to see and do in Seattle, Great choices of places to eat at within a few blocks, And Pike place is only about a ten minute walk if that!

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars hotel, 3 stars poor club services.”
Reviews.Author: macbcmini
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt Seattle. 4 days. Aug 2011. Deluxe King Club. $250-$300 a night. 1- East airport access by light rail. Landed at SEA 1045AM, in hotel room by noon. Train took 45 minutes. Get out at Westlake station, last stop, 1 block from hotel. $2.75 per person. 2- Hotel location is AAA, in downtown, surrounded by shops, restaurants, movie houses, shopping centers, it is like living in an upscale shopping center, from Tiffany to H&M, Forever 21, Gameworks, Niketown, they go on for 20 blocks of nonstop shopping and eating, Seattle has short blocks, easy to walk flat land. 3- DÃ©cor is good 5 Stars, usual Grand Hyatt wood, marble and carpet. Large bright room with sofa and generous space, big bathroom, marble and glass. Water pressure is too weak, toilet paper is the cheapest thinnest type. Elevators fast and not crowded. 4- Internet is $9.95 a day or $14.95 for faster premium. Free internet in Club lounge. 5- Club Lounge is 3 stars poor, not worthy of GRAND in the hotel name. The dÃ©cor is nice usual Grand Hyatt, but no espresso or cappuccino served nor DIY machine. Coffee is from pot or an antique VERY SLOW DIY coffee machine that makes strange noise. Espresso or cappuccino are most basic in all Hyatt and Business class lounges, how can they skip that? Continental breakfast and afternoon snacks are few and low quality on a tight 3â€™x3â€� small counter, they are the worst among all the Hyatt hotels, more on the level of a Hampton motel standards, less than or Embassy suites. How can they be so cheap on the best customers? Only 1 staff in lounge. Hotel general manager should be transferred to a motel to learn the business of hospitality. 6- Alternatives. Sheraton across the street is without such shortcomings, $100 less. Also next doors are 2 cheaper older hotels, Paramount and Roosevelt, at half the prices or less. There are plenty of restaurants and Starbucks on the blocks. 7- Hotel itself is fine usual Grand Hyatt, but this is the worst and cheapest in terms of Club lounge services. Take off the GRAND from the name, get a real professional Hyatt class manager. Staff is fine, hardly see any anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Really? Pay Wifi?”
Reviews.Author: Commagirl
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, very clean, no complaints except no free WiFi. Amazed that I can get free Wifi at the Motel 6 in Dalton, Georgia but must pay or go to the lobby Srarbucks at the $170/night Grand Hyatt. Spotlessly clean, helpful and knowledgeable concierge, valet kind enough to store our luggage for 10 hours, and somewhat easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: passkey96
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a corner suite, and it was great. Easy walking distance to Pikes Market. Cab fare to space needle and good resturants under $10.00.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Grand about the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: bubbieruth
Reviews.Content: I can say the location on Pine Street is terrific. The layout of the corner room is excellent as well as the bathroom...however the hotel is so sorely in need of refurbishing that it is shameful. Add to that I had to ask for the stained carpet to be vacuumed and dirty coffee cups to be removed from what was supposed to be a cleaned room. In this day and age not having free internet is ridiculous, however when we went into the business center even one of the two computers was broken. I would hesitate now to go to any Grand Hyatt after the experience with the Seattle hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Central City Hotel with Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Empty-Nesters1956
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle on a "weekend get-away." The staff was helpful and courteous. The room featured a spacious walk-in shower and over-sized bathtub with plenty of light for reading while in a soak. We didn't eat at the hotel's main restaurant -- but used the deli & coffeeshop for very acceptable breakfasts "on the go." The hotel is centrally located and convenient to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with friends and tour Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Charlene52
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was a great place to stay. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and pleasant. Check in was easy. They could point you in the right direction and supply you with an easy to read map. They will make reservations for you and offer suggestions for places to eat. The rooms were great- clean, roomy, and had lots of neat features like a button to draw the shades, a separate bath and shower, and a lighted closet with an in-room safe. You have access to a computer in the lobby (to all the airlines) so you can get your boarding passes before leaving the hotel. It is conveniently located in the downtown area. You can take the light rail from SeaTac to the Westlake Station and then walk for only about three blocks to get to the hotel. The Westlake Station is also where you can catch the monorail to the Seattle Center where the Space Needle is located along with several other interesting sites. You are about seven blocks from the Pike Place Market also and from there easy access to the waterfront. If you want to visit the Pioneer Square area, you can hop on the light rail and be there in minutes. In a three block radius you can find two shopping centers, the bookstores Borders and Barnes and Noble, and, of course, a Starbuck's on about every corner. There's a lot to see and do in Seattle. We had a CityPass (online) that made it easier to have tickets for several places. We would definitely suggest you do the Underground tour in Pioneer Square. We walked to most of the places. Be prepared for walking on the incline, especially if you go to Capital Hill to find The Elliott Bay Bookstore which has recently moved into the area. You might want to bring a jacket as the high temperature was 77 degrees in the middle of July.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, But.....”
Reviews.Author: capcity65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had occasion to stay at the Hyatt for our honeymoon. The hotel is centrally located to shopping, sights and the suburbs, where some of Seattle's hidden gems lie! The hotel's common areas are modern, clean and very tasteful. The staff are very attentive and friendly. The rooms are comfortable and well-appointed. The bathrooms are probably the best I've ever seen in a hotel, bar-none! Now for the not-so-good.... I hope you like a FIRM bed! Because that's what you'll get at the Grand Hyatt. And if there's one thing that ticks me off about 4 star hotels? It's when they nickle and dime you to death! $41 a day for valet parking? OK... But, you can park yourself for $30. Internet access will run you $10 a day for EACH DEVICE!!!! Pack a porta-router! Complimentary water? Forget it! A fridge to put water or anything else you buy in? No way. Unless you phone the front desk and ask them to bring one up to your room for an extra charge! The fridge in your room is solely devoted to the 'mini-bar'. Put anything in that fridge and your tab will swell by $10....

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location!”
Reviews.Author: littlthng3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle early March on a business trip. It was my first time visiting Seattle and I found the location to be very convienent for both business and pleasure. The hotel itself was very large and clean - and I always found the receptionists in the lobby to be very kind and accommodating. Since this was my first trip traveling alone, I had a lot of questions about directions/my room/places to see and the staff was more than helpful. One evening I had a problem with my hotel door/lock and the staff sent a manager up to make sure everything was okay. The hotel room was very clean - the room appeared to have more modern furniture/bedding and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large - with a huge soaking tub and lovely marble shower. I was always given extra toiletries and the housekeeping was on point. The hotel is within walking distance to shopping, the famous Pike Place Market (about 7 or 9 blocks away), and very close to the Convention Center (where I had workshops for the week). As for restaurants nearby - there is a Cheesecake Factory, Daily Grill and small coffee/sandwich shops for a quick bite to eat. I would definitely book the Grand Hyatt again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Colin3160
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a night at this hotel. What a great hotel and the location is perfect if you want to be downtown seattle in the heart of things. From the moment you step in you know you are staying at a professionally run hotel. Everything works well and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Comfy Room.”
Reviews.Author: 66HappyTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I am more accustomed to staying at Park Place Hyatt's than Grand Hyatt's so I had to adjust my expectations. With that said, the lobby is nicely designed as are the rooms. But half of the hotel has bad views regardless of what floor you are on. A few times we requested extra towels and a few other items like laundry service and each time the staff promptly helped. That was appreciated. So was the quick check in. The rooms are a little tight but the furniture, especially the bed was comfortable. The towels in the bathroom do not know the meaning of soft and that was a bit disappointing. I am highly attuned to smells and the room was overwhelmingly fragrant upon arrival. This is something that I could have done without. As is the ridiculous fee for the wi-fi. In this day & age it is insulting when a hotel charges for this service. It feels like they ought to charge to use the alarm clock while they are at it. If it were not for the Internet charge I would give this hotel a 4-star rating. But the charge feels like a thorn in my side so they get a 3-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Grand as its title!”
Reviews.Author: embargo
Reviews.Content: I found my experience while staying at the Grand Hyatt Seattle simply pleasant. The check-in process was smooth even after arriving late. I typically don't order room service because of cost and food quality. In this case food quality was not an issue. it was actually good.

Reviews.Title: “Love it so much we had our Wedding night here”
Reviews.Author: trritch
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this Grand Hotel for years for various reasons, so when we decided to get married, there was no other choice than to stay here along with our family and friends. Its Central to everything in downtown Seattle and the room are lovely and clean and the service is outstanding. If you plan to stay downtown, I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt, you can not go wrong. As well, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and Starbucks are on the first floor. I would request a corner room or a view of the City. You can not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern”
Reviews.Author: bhilln
Reviews.Content: Pricey but a great location and very nice hotel. Next to the convention center and easy walk to public transportation. Service was good and had all the comforts one needed. Room was very nice. Clean and modern. Downside is the cost, rooms are pricy to start with but then when you add the cost of parking, extra for internet and food it adds up quick. Didn't try the restaurant in the hotel but a Starbucks is in the hotel making for convenient morning coffee. Overall would recommend, especially if your here on business and can write expenses off.

Reviews.Title: “A Ray of Sunshine for Seattle”
Reviews.Author: charmtwo
Reviews.Content: Being that I was not impressed by the City of Seatlle as far as cleanliness, (the only word that comes to mind is "Grungy") I was appreciative of the quality of the Grand Hyatt on Pike Street. It was recently renovated and offerred a very modern feel. The hotel's lobby is open and offers comfortable yet stylish seating, which was perfect after a stroll downtown. My Husband and I stayed in a king non-smoking room with club access. The room was comfortable and offered a nice size bathroom with a separate tub and shower. With the exception of the mildew spot I found in the corner of the shower (housekeeping happily came and cleaned upon my request) the room appeared to be clean. I say appeared to be clean because while watching housekeeping clean the shower, I noticed a lot of cross contamination goes on during their cleaning process. I travel with clorox wipes and cleaned behind housekeeping. The staff in the club lounge was quite friendly and attentive. The front desk staff was friendly, however concierge was not very helpful in providing information regarding dining options in the area ( for nice dining the hotel only offers Ruth Chris Steakhouse). The concierge representative either did not know of the many restuarants nearby or did not want to be bothered in telling us about them. There is a mall across from the hotel with several dining options also a Cheese Cake Factory is on the corner of the hotel. I would recommend the "Blue Acres" restaurant located two blocks from the hotel; it offered good seafood with a cajun flair and the restuarant had a nice vibe to it also a good wine list. If I have to travel to Seattle again anytime soon, I would choose the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Meets Grand Hyatt expectations”
Reviews.Author: hcajones
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Hyatts for many years, and have generally been very pleased. Grand Hyatts are expected to be high standard (just below Park Hyatts), and this one met expectations. Calmly elegant in a sparse, modern way. Very friendly service. Comfortable and well-appointed rooms with especially comfortable bathrooms. Showing just a bit of wear and tear. Some rooms have wonderful view; many do not. We stayed here once before about a year ago and had a very similar, positive experience. $45 valet parking (about $50 with tax) is not outrageous for central hotels in big cities, but it does discourage people who are traveling by car. Perhaps that is so small a % of this hotel's business that they don't care, but it will keep us away next time we drive to Seattle to visit friends. We'll return to our mainstay, the Hyatt Regency Bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but view was not good”
Reviews.Author: lizzy_sj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here beginning of this year for a night. Room and bathrooom was spectacular. Even though the standard room was a bit crampy, it was exceptionally clean. Bed was very comfortable and fits a 4 star hotel. They have a pretty decent bar in the hotel itself. Only thing I did not like with the stay was the view from the room was not good. We could only see the roof and chimney of the next building.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: marianaflorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed an extra day in Seattle after an Alaska cruise and chose this hotel for proximity to everything. The service at the hotel was fantastic, our room was immaculate and had a very welcome deep tub for a soak. Loved it. The Ruth Chris restaurant in the lobby served breakfast and it was delicious with perfect service. There are also a Starbucks in the lobby, a deli and a great sushi restaurant. We were walking distance to Pikes Market, Nordstrom, and the metro for the Space needle. I would definitely stay here again when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation Always!!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzierose1
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel to stay even if you want to just get away for a weekend!! Great views, service, and accomodations. I love the corner rooms! The beds are so comfy and if you get a chance add the Grand Club Access!!! My next treat to myself is to get a suite! Stay tune! I've stayed here over 8 times!!! Thank You Grand Hyatt Seattle!!

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kpatton19
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Seattle for a meeting, I got to go for fun and shopping. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Walking distance to major shopping and Pike Place Market. Also close to the monorail to Seattle Center. The bathrooms are huge - with a separate soaking tub and glass shower. The rooms are a nice size and have blackout screens. Check-in was fast and the people are very friendly and helpful. We will be back on our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “just loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthElvis
Reviews.Content: grand hyatt is grand, good location, spotless, and has friendly efficient staff. We must say thank you to rowda at check in desk she sent up a bottle of wine & chocolates to us as it was a combined 50th birthday & 31st wedding anniversary. We were very suprised and grateful. The luggage porter Mike was also very friendly he gave us plenty of information and tips on the best tours eateries ect. Conceirge was efficient and friendly helped with our requests. We had a nice room on the 21st floor with a view of the lake and city we had no trouble sleeping in Seattle if we ever come here again we would definately stay at this hotel. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Close but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2teens
Reviews.Content: Great location,,, but be advised they charge for everything. If you so much as lift something out of the fridge you own it. Same with the candy counter in the room. There are alot of hidden fees in this hotel. Do not max yourself out on the room price, and be prepared for all the extras in the final bill. Parking (self) is $30 per night and Valet is $45 per night. Neither is included in the price of the room. Aside from that it is everything you expect a Hyatt to be. Great location, super friendly staff, amazing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “worst overnight trip ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: ferrismm
Reviews.Content: When we booked the Hyatt we were told that we had a corner unit with a view of Lake Union so we could watch the firework display. The room was 499.00 per night. We also told them it would be 2 adults and 2 children. We only live 30 miles away from this Hyatt we were going just to see the fireworks for the kids. When we arrived our room wasnt a corner unit, it had 1 small room with a view of building and 1 bed. We were very upset. The front desk tried to put us in a room that would have a view of the fireworks. They said that the fireworks go up high so we should be able to see them. They brought in roll away beds for the kids. When the fireworks started we couldnt see anything!!!! Both Kids Were Crying. I cant believe we paid that much money for nothing. we should have just drove to the fireworks. They did take 250.00 off the bill but still not worth the 266.00 when the kids were on roll away beds.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself!”
Reviews.Author: ClassicalEd
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location, a clearly well-trained staff (at all levels) quite responsive and friendly, and decor manages to be quite modern but plush/warm/cozy too. Similar to other better hotels in area, offers loan of umbrellas, terry robes, etc. Turn-down-for-bed service appreciated. Note: proportion of sq. ft. in a 2 DoubleBR largely allotted to lavish bathroom as compared to living/sleeping space. (Not a problem if there are only 2 of you... we had a couple more!) Had north-facing room on 24th floor, so view of Space Needle and other high-rises with limited view of bay. Walkable to Pike Place Market, more of a schlepp to Pioneer Square or ferry piers. Minor peeves: no free wi/fi; no coffee/tea apparatus; and mini-bar/fridge automatically charges if door simply opened for a little! These are odd cheeseparing touches to such a high-end-feeling hotel... but it has successfully won our business over from the nearby Westin, our previous stay, or even from the waterfront hotel simply because we were so comfortable. Starbucks in lobby not open late.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Content: Great location. Lots of great shopping and restaurants nearby. Easy wandering distance to Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square and Belltown. Sara at the front desk found us a room with a view. All the staff were very nice, including the housekeeping staff. The bathroom was splendiferous with a soaker tub and a lovely stand up shower with great water pressure. As someone with sleep problems I appreciated the blackout curtain. The bed was very comfortable. It was great having a Starbucks downstairs. Complaints we have are that you can't even open the bar fridge without incurring a debt.
