I guess this is to stop you from keeping beverages cold that you buy yourself. It just seemed petty. The hotel does offer to bring up a separate fridge, but for a charge. Also, although the room was nicely appointed, the carpet looked grubby and in need of replacing. We didn't use the valet parking. We found out there's a cheaper option. We parked in the public parkade around the corner, but in the same building with hotel access. Other than that it was a great experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The bathroom itself is a spa!”
Reviews.Author: cristacueto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for two nights and couldn't have been more impressed. The staff were extremely friendly and the hotel was beautiful. Our very large room had a view of Puget Sound and was stylish and comfortable. The bathroom was exquisite. There is a separate shower and bathtub. The oversized bathtub has a cascading spout - don't know quite how to describe it, but it fills up in a matter of minutes. I was absolutely luxurious. I want to go back to Seattle again just so we can stay at this hotel :) Location is great too - right in the middle of great shopping and an easy walk to Pike's Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury isn't always friendly”
Reviews.Author: casabear
Reviews.Content: At the Grand Hyatt Seattle if you aren't part of the elite, they'll help you feel unwelcome. This was a beautiful hotel, but as soon as I checked in they treated me like low class. They remind you many times that they charge for everything; snacks in your room, drinks, Internet and parking. I was afraid to touch anything for fear of seeing a charge on my bill. There are ice machines on 3 floors only and you have to go quite a ways to get to one. The bathroom was gorgeous, with marble counters and stone floors, glass shower doors and lots of space. The bed was roomy and soft with lots of pillows. I wish they would put a small fridge in the room to keep your own drinks in. No free breakfast here, so you'll need to walk a block or two. The room was quiet but I was surprised how well I could hear the outside traffic even though I was 12 stories up. The doors are very noisy when they slam shut, and I don't understand why they can't do something about that. Every time someone would come and go...SLAM, SLAM. The gym was great, very well maintained and lots of equipment to choose from. There are a lot of stores and restaurants nearby. Traffic is horrible and it was hard to find somewhere to park. They charge $30 per day to park at the hotel or you can pay $20 outside across the street. Overall, it was nice but I don't think I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: shep77
Reviews.Content: Location wise it is in the heart of the dining and shopping district of downtown Seattle. The hotel itself is average. Reception was cool and perfunctory. The rooms are on the small side but clean and understated and quiet. We had a wheelchair accessible bathroom and neither of us is disabled. You have to pay for WiFi: expensive and a rip-off. Nice that they have a Starbucks on the premises so you don't have to leave the building to get your fix. I guess some rooms have great views; we looked out over the roof and vents of the Ruths Chris restaurant (yes, whiffs of steak every now and then!) and an adjacent condo high rise (close enough that you could wave to the people living there!). Have stayed at better hotels in the area so I won't stay here again unless I'm desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful views of city and water”
Reviews.Author: acposu
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, room was high-quality suite-type room. seperate living room, bath, and bedroom. bathroom was luxurious and I do not use that word lightly...it was awesome. we had corner room that had windows facing city and right down to the pike market sign and elliot bay beyond. sat there a couple times and just watched the sound ferries going out and back. staff very helpful with room request, so try for whatever room you want. I'd stay there again next time I'm in seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: johnathome
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Seattle again for another client. Stayed at the Hyatt with a group of others from my firm. Arrived at the Hyatt early afternoon from the east coast. Fortunately my room was ready (up on the 21st floor with a view over the Roosevelt hotel's red neon sign next door. Guest room looked like the rooms on their website. King bed was very comfortable. Electronic black screen to block out the outside was a nice touch. Although occasionally you could hear a door slam, the room was very quiet and I had a good night sleep. Work desk was fine but there were not enough electric plugs. Was given free wired wifi which was fine. Electronic safe and plenty of closet space. Bathroom included a shower and large deep bathtub. Strangely no cups in the bathroom but there was toothpaste. Location is good. Starbucks in the building with a deli and Japanese restaurant attached. If you wanted to shop, plenty of shopping a few blocks away. The hotel restaurant was a Ruth Chris. Had breakfast and one lunch there. Service and food were fine. The gym was on the 4th floor. No windows but several machines and free weights. No pool but apparently there is a sauna / whirlpool. Was left a bill under my door the night before so check out was quick. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt and would recommend it for work or pleasure. Compared to the FS which I stayed at also, this was a nice alternative and less pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: ancoraimparo
Reviews.Content: After spending time at a wedding in Eastern Washington, we arrived at the hotel and was greeted at the valet station and welcomed to a magnificent lobby and reception area. Everyone was professional creating a great start to our two day stay. I asked for a great view of the city and Lily at the front desk obliged us with suite 2118. It faced due west looking out to Pugent sound with the Roosevelt hotel sign in the foreground and beautiful sunsets (not always available). The room was the right size as the bathroom had a soaking tub and marbled shower - big enough for four adults. It was a welcomed experience. The hotel is located 8 blocks from waterfront and fish market. If you walk down Pine street you pass the retail stores, the monorail - which takes you to the Space Needle and Science Center, restaurants, pubs and lots of people watching. Everything felt easy and smooth, allowing us to experience the city the way we like - at our own pace. The valet car service was pricey at $34 a day. You had unlimited in/out access and we needed a car to visit friends in another part of the city. There is a sushi restaurant, a Ruth Chris Steak house and a Starbucks on the lobby floor...which was perfect to grab a quick latte before heading out in the morning. Check out was smooth, the front desk and staff always greeted you professionally and always available for questions. We would stay here again and I highly recommend the hotel for those who like high end hotel experience and quality sleep on the pillow top beds.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRN1117
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in an Executive Suite with my husband and 21 month old son. It was a perfect haven for our family. Large suite with huge master bath with double shower heads, large tub, separate toilet, ample counter space. Robes and a real bathroom rug. I appreciated the small vanity area in the walk-in closet. Automatic shades kept out the sun and room was very quiet. 1/2 bath upon entering room was a bonus, as was the sink in the bar area. Crib was set up and came with sheets, a blanket and a Johnson & Johnson baby toiletry travel set...a nice surprise! The location was perfect. Very easy to navigate the downtown from this location. Having a Starbucks, a sushi restaurant, a deli and Ruth's Chris Steak House all in the hotel, made this hotel perfect for us. All the stores you could want were within blocks from the hotel. Easy walk to Pike Place Market. Wasn't a bad walk to the Seattle Center, although we took a detour to the Whole Foods and then took the monorail back downtown after spending time at the Seattle Center. No free wi-fi and parking was expensive, but those charges are on par for most large hotels in big cities, so it wasn't a surprise. We will definitely return here if our travels bring us back to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: opus36
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with the amenites that Hyatt is known for possesing. It's location was kinda of confusing to get to during my stay as construction had blocked off part of Olive St. I stayed on the 8th floor and the noise level wasn't too bad, but there was either a bus stop or some sort of depot somewhere close, and the squeal of the breaks every few minutes became kinda irritating. I used the valet on a daily basis, and the gentlemen there were very efficient and helpful. The room was kept very clean and replenished everything I needed. Room service was also very efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: familylikes2travel
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, beautiful rooms, amazing view. We were treated like royalty here...all the staff are exceptionally nice. Compliments to Jocelyn at reception who was so personable and made us feel welcome after a tiring day of travel. The champagne and chocolates in our room for our anniversary put this hotel over the top, and we will definitely stay here again and strongly recommend it to other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, pretty good location.”
Reviews.Author: stephanie_2448
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are great and very helpful. The hotel is about 7 blocks from most tourist attractions, but the walk is nice. Shopping and various restaurants are located right around the corner. There is a fridge in the room, but it is a minibar. You can request a fridge and the charge is $5. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a queen!”
Reviews.Author: kapev
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle for two nights. Can't wait to go back! It was about a 10 minute walk to Pike Place Market which was really cool and it was in the downtown hub. We attended Mary Poppin's at the Paramount Theater which we could see from our window just about one or two blocks up the street. There was great shopping all around the hotel and some great restaurants close by. The room itself was very heavenly! I slept very well. The decor was very hip and trendy. The bathroom - wow! I want a bathroom like this! Granite everywhere with beautiful fixtures. This place is truly a 5 stars! I felt like royalty. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !!!”
Reviews.Author: jjjjjjjj23
Reviews.Content: Downtown in the middle of the action. Close to everything and transportation. Great help for us to go places. You do not need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Love Grand Hyatt Seattle”
Reviews.Author: SecretNote
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Beautiful lobby, rooms, meeting space,great food presentations. Well kept. Bathrooms in most rooms have tubs and huge showers. Love "Do not disturb" button that controls the doorbell. Walking distance to most attractions. David the bellman was very attentive and friendly, took great care of our fish so we can bring it safely home. The only thing is make sure you do not leave anything behind in the room, you will never get a call from lost and found again they just loose your phone number.......... My bad for leaving it, but just a little of follow up would help.

Reviews.Title: “No reply to survey”
Reviews.Author: hospitality4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in April of this year. we were given special rate for the conference for parking and internet. When we arrived by car to the hotel, we were greeted by the bellman and rudely told to park our own car. We were checked in fast and courteous however room booked was wrong which was quickly remedied. We went up to the room and were pleasantly surprised with the room. It had a king size bed, shower and tub, nice decor and comfortable. I connected to the internet and took over 10 minutes to log in, I called the desk and immediately I was told that no one reported this problem. I stated by not reporting the problem, it does not mean it does not exist. I requested a fix as we were going out for dinner. Upon my return I did not see any call back or slip in room advising of internet being fixed. I tried again and same problems. I called the desk and the guy I spoke to repeated same thing that no one reported it. I stated that I am a person who has good technical knowledge of computers and internet and would like to speak to someone who can help. they gave me a number to call, the cord on the desk had the name Guest_Tek, so when the tech answered the phone I inquired if this is guest Tek, he replied no we are a different company. You would think that The Hyatt can afford new cords to correspond with their tech company. After a 15 minute conversation with tech we finally had it working correctly. The 3rd night when we tried to leave the parking lot, we were almost treated like criminals, apparently the lot is not controlled by Hyatt but some company who does parking. The manager said we gave them this rate for conference but no ni and out privileges. I said we will pay for the whole stay and asked him to figure out a way that works. after 15 minutes we fixed the problem and left. A few days after check out I received a survey request from Hyatt and filled out outlining my issues. Today is almost 30 days and no respond from them.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the same quality of service if you book through hotwire/priceline”
Reviews.Author: holidayer80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is is good value if you book through a third party. However, I would not be happy to have had to pay 200 dollars a night for the room. I visited Seattle with my sister for a shopping trip and paid for the room through priceline. We were told when we got there we could not get a double bed room because we booked through priceline. We were given a king room they had left. I am sure if we paid full price, there would have been a room available for our needs, but it was clear that the person at the check-in was not exhausting all resources to please the guest because (like he said) we booked through a third party. That being said, the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was awesome, with the exception of the conditioner which was pathetically useless. The gym was also a little on the sad side, which was a bit of a disappointment. There was no circulation of air and the cardio machines were completely full when I arrived for a run at 10 am. It definately could be bigger and have more equipment. All in all, I would give this hotel a 3 out of 5. If I paid full price, I would be a tad dissapointed. Staff should not stick up their noses at people who pay for the hotel through priceline or hotwire. We are guests, after all. And because of this service, I will not be returning to pay full price. You need to be aware that people who pay through a third party are customers just asking to be won over, not treated like second class citizens.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, awesome location, soft bed (too soft)”
Reviews.Author: James-Vancouverite
Reviews.Content: Needed a weekend get away from everyday life, saw a great deal on this hotel, decided on a impromptu get away by myself. Excellent rooms, very clean (as expected). Lobby doors were not automatic and had no doorman... which is the only strange part. Parking is a bit pricey but is expected for a downtown location, valet gives you in/out privileges but self park does not, and it's only 4 dollars difference. close to all the shopping and pikes place market and library. Starbucks attached to the hotel if you need to leech wifi because hotel charges 9.95/24hr for basic wifi, come on people it is 2011. Friends I went with (their family) got two adjoining rooms at no extra charge (one was a suite). So they were very accommodating. Careful with the shower though... the tiles are slippery and you need that slip resistant mat in there for sure! The bed, like most hotel beds... was too soft. That's my only real complaint.

Reviews.Title: “High rate and $40 parking fee per day!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler5
Reviews.Content: Definitely a business expense hotel. Rooms nicely furnished but not enough plugs convenient for charging. Staff was okay. Expensive food options in hotel. Convenient to pikes market and shopping, but would not be my choice on a return. high room rate plus $40 a day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but limited food services and no meaningful room amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Larry86
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean room and great banquet food. But with only Ruths Chris Steak House on property limited food choices. Breakfast price in Ruths were outrageous, $18 for coffee, juice and oatmeal. Would choose mid range motor inn next trip to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect hotel for business or pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: BCHospitalityGal
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel so much I don't know where to begin! The staff were excellent. The location is perfect - walking distance to shopping, arts and plenty of restaurants. Ruth Chris Steakhouse restaurant and lounge off the lobby plus there's a Starbucks off the lobby as well. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Plenty of workspace but I did have to crawl under the desk to plug in my laptop. Electronically operated black out blinds were a nice touch, and the huge bathroom - finished in a combination of granite and what looked to be marble - was an unexpected treat. Would I go back? Yes - in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zooloo13vancouver
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel when staying in Seattle. The service was excellent, rooms were super clean, Great location. I was able to hear the noise from outside while sleeping. Other than that, two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinMadrid
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in every aspect, the location is ideal as right in downtown Seattle. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were amazing and large with views of the water that were unparallel. However, I was in room on the 23rd floor that seemed to be recently renovated. One of my collegues was in a room on the 7th floor and it wasn't the nice room that I described. We went to the restaurant in the lobby for breakfast and it was quite good. I will definitely be staying here again next time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “shhhhhh i can hear you from the hallway”
Reviews.Author: QFOX
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the one bedroom suite is large and clean. Tub and shower. The reception staff were nice and helpful. Internet was a rip off, however there is a Starbucks in the Lobby. I used it and didn't order anything, no problems. Our stay was durring the Superbowl weekend and they had a bachelorette group staying in the hotel also, same floor as us. Im not sure if we were wrong for talking late at night as our voices were no louder than a TV on at a late hour. Well we get a phone call saying there has been a complaint from a neighbor room. So of course we lower our voices. 5 minutes or so the security guard is at our door saying "i can hear your voices from the hallway." we hardly believe this and somewhat upset with accusation. Heres the kicker for us, we went to another room 3 doors down to join a small party. The people were loud and lively and in a smaller room. no complaints came. Maybe just a busy night for security. The hotel is comfortable and again good location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location; skimped on room amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mohsman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt, Seattle Tuesday through Saturday with my wife. The hotel is beautiful, trendy with very good service. It is just across from the convention center and has a Ruthâ€™s Chris (that even serves breakfast), a Starbucks, NY-style deli, and Blue C Sushi attached. A Cheesecake factory is on the corner of the building but not attached to the Hyatt. The doorman, valets, bellman (especially Jazz), front desk and maids were all very good. We chose a club room which served a decent breakfast but seemed to skimp on the variety of food items for the evening appetizer & drink session. The club room did have very nice computer stations, TVâ€™s, chairs and couches, and a fantastic view. The room was certainly large enough with a very comfortable king-size bed. What disappointed my wife and me was that the desk (i.e. the place to put your computer, cell phone, etc.) only had one available wall plug, hidden and inconveniently located behind the desk. Most hotel desks have lamps with electrical outlets in their bases, or several outlets purpose-built into the desk. Not so with our desk; just a plain desk and one hidden plug. Also, only every third or fourth floor had an ice machine. When I needed ice (which was daily so my wife could ice her post-op foot) I had to go from the my 25th floor room to the 28th floor - or call for ice and wait. They also only provided two glasses for the room and no paper/plastic cups. We prefer to use two glasses for drinks and have two in the BR. When we would bring glasses down from the club â€“ to put on the bathroom counter, they were consistently gone in the morning. Moreover, the towels were remarkably thin and limp, not what youâ€™d expect from a high-end hotel; and they only provided two hand towels and two not-so-large bath towels. (The towels at the Staybridge Inn and Hampton Inns where we also stayed on our trip were much larger and more plush â€“ and each gave us four of each.) We were surprised and disappointed that Hyatt would cut corners on the Club food, towels, and a decent computer desk. Otherwise, we had a nice stay and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, great employees and service”
Reviews.Author: Koshman
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle, Washington USA and everyone we came in contact with was friendly, accomodating and dedicated to the service they were responsible for. The room was clean and beautiful also.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and small - just okay”
Reviews.Author: AnelaS
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and 16 year old daughter. They have very few rooms with two queen beds so we had to book a king room - which had a queen bed - not a king. The room was small, just enough room to walk around the bed. There was a separate sitting room with a small sofa - that is my 16 year old slept on. There wasn't any room for a roll away to be brought in. However, the bathroom was big and beautiful with a spa type tub and a separate shower. The location was a plus as well - within walking distance to Pikes Market and lots of shopping - and convenient to bus system. Overall, just an okay experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Rossco10
Reviews.Content: From check in to departure the staff were professional, friendly and helpful. The room whilst not overly large was comfortable with a separate area away from the bedroom which had seating and a second television. The bathroom lacked nothing and everything was extremely clean. The hotel is in a very good location with shopping and restuarants just a short walk. Pike markets was a 10-15 minutes walk and the waterfront 20 minutes. We booked for four nights and overall this was a very pleasant hotel with very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful accomodations, gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: chris_grass
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hyatt due to a meeting that I was attending. The accomodations were exceptional -- attention to every detail. The staff were all very helpful and welcoming. The banquet manager, who made sure that our meeting room needs were met, was wonderful. The food that was available for our group was also presented very well -- everything looked appetizing and tasted good too. The hotel was 3 short blocks from the Link light rail system, which will take you to and from the airport for only $2.50 each way. My only complaint is that there were not enough outlets in our room. We ended up having to plug in our cell phone chargers in the bathroom. Other than that, my stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat”
Reviews.Author: elbaird
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a conference I attended. The hotel hotel had a low key and simple feel to it. I loved my room. The bed was comfortable and I thought the electronic shades were great. The bathroom was the best part. It was huge..almost half the size of the suite. It had an inviting soaking tub with some cool fixtures and a huge mirror over the tub. The shower separate and rather large. I loved the rooms and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Business Hotel in the United States”
Reviews.Author: kilimanjarodan
Reviews.Content: As a consultant, I travel 150+ nights per year. From 2009 through this year, I've spent at least 50 nights at the Grand Hyatt and at the Olive 8, its trendier and younger sibling across the street. The Grand Hyatt has a great location, and all the amenities, but the rooms and service set it apart. As a Hyatt Diamond member, I'm usually upgraded to a suite here... and the suites here are incredible. My favorites are the suites on the 19th and 20th floors at the northwest corner of the hotel. The west wall of windows looks out over Pike Place Market and the water; the north windows look out over the Space Needle. The only faults I can find with this hotel are that: 1) it lacks a pool; and 2) the gym, while well appointed, is an interior room with no external windows. When I need to swim or when the Grand Hyatt is booked, I'm also happy to stay at the aforementioned Hyatt Olive 8 across the street. While there are several compelling luxury boutique hotels downtown, you really can't go wrong with Hyatt in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fine customer service - would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: alina12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business the week before Valentine's day. The room was spacious, the bathroom in particular was huge. Everything was clean and modern looking. Ordered room service the first night, as I got in after 8pm and did not feel like going out. Ordered a burger and fries, which were very good and the food arrived in 30 minutes, as promised. The location, as has been mentioned by others, is excellent. I would like to commend the customer service of both the housekeeping staff and the evening security staff, as the day that I checked out, I forgot that I had left 2 shirts in a drawer. By the time I got home and looked in my suitcase, it was 9 pm. When I called the hotel, I was connected to the lost and found area, where housekeeping had turned in my shirts. I was assisted by Trae McCoy, who had the shirts sent to me by Fed Ex in 2 days. I would like to thank the staff for the excellent service, it was much appreciated. I would recommend the Grand Hyatt to all my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay near convention center”
Reviews.Author: BusyTrveller
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room and bed. Luxurious bathroom. Nice view from the upper floors. The hotel is located about 1 block from the convention center. I had originally thought that the route to the convention center was indoors, but it is actually outdoors. However, the entire path is protected by awnings and/or glass ceilings. No need for an umbrella! If you DO need an umbrella, there is a full-size one provided as a courtesy in your room, so you don't need to pack one. You also don't need to pack a bathrobe. I am usually more of an economy traveller, so I missed having a fridge and microwave in the room. The button operated window shades were cool--the button is by your bed. There is NOT a dedicated airport shuttle van, but there is a "downtown airporter" shuttle van that goes to all the major downtown hotels, including the Grand Hyatt which costs around $25 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a business trip and loved it. The design is gorgeous and welcoming, the desk staff charming, and it is truly full service. Very W like in terms of the feeling, which made it a restful place at the end of a long business day. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Adjoining room was AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Edison04
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very prompt and efficient from the valet parking area to the check in. Room was available before check in time which is always a plus! Couldnt ask for a better location for shopping and seeing the sights Had a corner suite with an adjoining room for 2 teenagers worked out great! close to nice restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPat11
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel I'm downtown Seattle. Yes, it's a little pricey but the room and view made the price worth it. The hotel overall is modern and contemporary. They have great professional staff and are over eager to help. The hotel also has the Ruth Chris restaurant and I fully recommend it. The hotel is in a perfect location and is within walking distance to Pikes Market, couple of movie theaters, and near the downtown shopping centers. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely relaxing start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: elliemay4395
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. Loved our room, the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Our bathroom was also amazing, huge bath and separate shower, spotlessly clean too. The staff were very professional and helpful also. Seattle is gorgeous, was sad to leave the hotel and the city!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Tipster2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in the Grand Hyatt Seattle in January, 2011 in an Emerald Suite. My room was on a corner on the 30th (top) floor. The views were great out onto Elliott Bay and at the Space Needle. The room was more than spacious. The bath had a separate shower. I thought the rate was reasonable for the size and quality of the room. I heard no noise from the hall or from adjacent rooms. Things less than perfect included the lighting which was relatively dim. There was no good reading lamp by a chair or sofa. The HVAC was drafty and cool. I finally got it to an acceptable warmth by setting the two thermostats to 75 degrees. Wi-Fi internet access cost $10 per night. It should have been free. The hotel is two blocks from the Westlake station on the light rail line. I was able to use light rail to get to the airport at a cost of $2.50. Trains run at least every 15 minutes and the travel time from Westlake to SeaTac was 38 minutes. The Westlake station is part of the bus tunnel system and I used buses to get around downtown for free. The hotel has three eating options: 1) Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, 2) Starbucks and 3) a so-called deli with an assortment of cafeteria-style foods. I found the deli unappealing. I had a decent sandwich at Starbucks. I had two excellent and reasonably price breakfasts at Ruth's plus a light early dinner there. I was pleased with Ruth's on all counts. Downtown Seattle has a lot of interesting things to see and do, including an abundance of restaurants. I visited the impressive Central Library and the Art Museum. A disappointment was the Sculpture Garden north of downtown which had very few sculptures.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back”
Reviews.Author: stanleylo
Reviews.Content: World class, clean, great location, modern design, almost next to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and service!”
Reviews.Author: Kidlet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for our anniversary. What a great view and location! We could see the Space Needle and the Pike Place Market. The service was wonderful. We had a suite, so comfortable. The only problem was..there's a steak house in the lobby, and the common areas smelled like cooking and meat. I'm a vegetarian so maybe I'm more sensitive than most but I didn't like that..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Evening Escape”
Reviews.Author: NWTravelerz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night, so we could attend a play at the 5th Avenue and get some Christmas shopping done. It was a short walk and close to all the shops, including Pacific Place. We ended up with a corner room with a gorgeous view. Service was excellent and clearly this hotel was worthy of out-of-town visitors, since the Carolina Panthers stayed there before their match-up against the Seahawks.

Reviews.Title: “check your bill carefully”
Reviews.Author: travelswithmimi
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice facility for a conference. We were given a corner suite which was very nice. The bed was comfortable and the view was good. WiFi cost was $10.00 per day. There is no pool or workout room so we had to go to their other hotel a block away. Since I often have a child with me this would be a problem. The bathroom is very stylish but the lighting at the sink is dim. The room was very quiet as far as street noise but hallway noise was sometimes a problem. No gift shop to purchase any necessities or snacks (again a problem when travelling with a child). I had to go to the IGA 5 blocks away to buy snacks and a salad. When I took out some cans in the minibar to put the small salad in, the sensors showed I had taken the mini bar items, even though they were put back in. My company got the bill and paid it then asked me about the minibar charges. I did get it straightened out but it was annoying to have to hassle with it. I also used the Elaia Spa at the Olive 8 Hyatt and charged it to my room. Yikes...the room charge was 42.00 higher than the charge slip I had...so I had to get that taken care of. It was however, the best massage I have ever had and probably the worst manicure I've ever had. Because I am in Seattle 4 or more times a year I have stayed at many of the downtown upscale hotels. I had stayed at The Grand Hyatt one other time. For the money there are better places in my opinion...especially if you have a child. I will return to one of the others next time.

Reviews.Title: “Steve@ valet area made out visit”
Reviews.Author: Deba00
Reviews.Content: Steve Peterson, was in charge of the valet area on the 3rd and 4th of Dec., he was just great! Directing traffic, employees, guests, luggage, would have made a mear mortal crazy. He did it with humor, style and boundless energy. Hotel manager, listen up, you have a gem on your hands! The hotel is nice, it will need a touch up in the near future, some things show a bit of wear....but our group remarked that the service they recieved was really extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect downtown business hotel”
Reviews.Author: NRoePDX
Reviews.Content: Lovely amenities, comfortable and large rooms, terrific public space - and very often on Priceline. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: bethana
Reviews.Content: I hadn't considered staying here at first because it was out of our price range for this trip, and AAA discounts for hotels usually aren't that great. However, the AAA rate was an amazing discount (don't know if it always would be). I've stayed at other hotels in Seattle, and for the money this hotel is the best value. Another tip: ask for a "quiet room" when you reserve. I didn't know exactly what this was when I requested it online, but it turned out that these rooms are typically on the higher floors (ours was on the 20th) away from ice machines, elevators, and other "noisemakers". Our room was very quiet! Another feature that I think is underrated on their website is the bathrooms. We stayed in the standard king room, and the bathroom was wonderful. Typically you have to book a higher grade room to get a 4-piece bath. They have Kohler fixtures, marble tile, and adjustable lighting. Everything you want for a relaxing bath. The view from our room was spectacular, especially at 7 this morning as the snow came down over the city. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR - *****”
Reviews.Author: Luigi-Li
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on Nov 11th and Nov 13th....It was our fisrt trip to Seattle and We LOVED IT...The hotel is beautiful!! As soon as we checked in we were upgraded to a corner suite~~~ The view was FANTASTIC......What I want to say is that FRONT DESK AGENT was very polite and attentive...... The hotel is very well located ..right on Downtown.....the restaurant "Ruth's Chris Steak house" serves very good food and great HAPPY HOUR food and drinks!! If you are planning a trip to Seattle this is the hotel you should stay at!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chefjeff60
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel..... I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle on my Birthday Nov 5th 2010 for one night. They upgraded me to a nice corner suite. The customer service is outstanding in this hotel everyone was so nice and the room was very nice with a great view and a big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Second Visit (with some minor issues)”
Reviews.Author: VacationPlanner
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Seattle Grand Hyatt. It was a choice between the Grand Hyatt and the Hyatt Olive 8 across the street. We decided on the Grand Hyatt due to a great room rate, we were familiar with the property and while the room at the Olive would have been larger, it just seemed a bit cold and stark compared with the Hyatt. Check in went smoothly and we were pleased with our room overlooking Pine Street. Our double bed room was comfortable and clean, I still get a kick out of the movable window shades there. The bath was large and roomy with a tub and separate shower stall. Overall we received very efficient service from the staff there. My interactions with the front desk, concierge and bellman were professional and courteous. The only glitch was with housekeeping. Usually Grand Hyatt service is extremely prompt, but this time there were a couple of minor issues that really surprised us on this visit. Upon arrival in the late afternoon we noticed only two sets of towels for our family. We called down and requested extra towels and drinking glasses. After a couple of hours we called again, but never received them that evening so had to share towels and glasses. The next morning we asked the cleaning staff to put them out for us which they did. The other issue was our ice bucket was not emptied and our used drinking glasses were still there on the desk after our room was serviced. Nothing to ruin our stay, but very noticeable and hopefully not something that happens regularly. This is a great property in a very convenient location which is the reason we stayed here. Pike Place Market is an easy walk and there are many stores, several malls and lots of restaurants in the immediate area. Free bus service is available at the Westlake station to get down to Qwest Field and Safeco Stadium which we used to see the Seahawks game. We will definitely consider the Grand Hyatt again when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel value we've had in years”
Reviews.Author: MikeM57
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay! We went here for our 30th aniversary and had a wonderful time. We stayed in a corner suite and the views were spectacular. The room was modern and clean. The hotel ammenities were excellent and the decor was great. The staff was very helpful. The location of the hotel is great, just a block from the transit station and many great restaurants. It is only a few more blocks from Pike's Place market, which we walked to a few times each day. You can also easily walk to the Space Needle, but the monorail is only a couple of blocks away too. There were two things that they could improve on. There is no restaurant for breakfast in or near the hotel, we had to walk a block to the Daily Grill (which is at the Sheraton). Also, as with many hotels today, the TV system is still analog delivery to the rooms, so very bad picture quality. Hopefully they update this soon... Overall this was a wonderful experience and we look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!!! The rooms were...”
Reviews.Author: sian421
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!!! The rooms were gorgeous, especially the marble bathroom with the soak in tub! The location is great, especially if you like shopping! It's close to a large nordstroms and multiple stores. It's also in easy walking distance to the waterfront and pike place market. I am very picky with hotels and I thought the grand hyatt was top notch!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Traveler925925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a hotel to stay in Downtown Seattle for a few nights. After looking at many choices, we decided that instead of spending money for okay accommodation we would prefer to spend $200 more for a great experience. The location was perfect for shopping and restaurants but about 2 blocks away from what seemed to be the busiest streets, so we felt that was the best of both worlds. Ruth hris in the building is fabulous! The best breakfast besides of course they're great lunch and evening selections. The staff was great, I forgot our wedding album in the room and they searched for it and had it delivered to me the next day in Canada which I was so grateful for. Our room was great, on the 18th floor, very spacious for a hotel room, great view and I could live in the bathroom All in all, we have no complaints at all and were so pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Journeyboomers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and found this to be a quality hotel. The 3 hour city tour as organized by the concierge was excellent. Free internet should be offered. Strongly recommend the attached restaurant Ruth Chris and the slider menu before 6pm for those wanting a lighter meal. Top service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Slept Well In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TYOTP
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our room, #2903. Over 800 sq/ft, corner suite on the 29th floor. It was fantastic. The hotel is immaculate. With the exception of the concierge, the entire hotel staff smiles (but he was very helpful). As for location, yes, this Hyatt is in a very good location but what decent hotel in Downtown Seattle isn't in a good location. Stay here because you get the quality and service of Hyatt. Our Emerald Suite felt like we were living in our own condo. Tip 1: Try to book out as far as you can and do the eStandby Upgrade. We orginally booked a Corner Suite through the CostCo Website for $183.30 a night. The upgrade to the Emerald Suite was another $39 a night. A little over $220 a night for an incredible room. Tip 2: You really don't need to rent a car in Seattle. Take the train from SeaTac Airport ($5.00 roundtrip per person) and it drops you off at the Westlake Station, two blocks from the Hyatt. We can't wait to get back to the Grand Hyatt Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “great choice for seattle city area”
Reviews.Author: TCK33
Reviews.Content: An easy location but what makes it great is the contemporary style, and the room fixtures and fittings eg automated blinds to allow the view of the water as you wish, great bed, and a fantastic bathroom especially for this price for Club room. We arrived early after departing a cruise ship and nothing was too much trouble - the only odd thing is that you can't have wine included in the Club Lounge, you need to pay for it, by law. The food was great. Starbucks right next door was a great bonus after a long day of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Good Service at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: un_papillon
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle because of the great rate of about $150 a night. We arrived on a Sunday morning and although we could not get into our room at that time, they did take our numbers and called us when the room was ready. They stowed our luggage and we ate breakfast at a nearby restaurant. About the time we were done eating, they called and informed us that our room was ready. Overall, the room was clean and well furnished. There was some wear behind the nightstand. It looked like the room used to have a single king bed with headboard instead of two doubles. But that is my only gripe. The bathroom is beautiful with a huge soaking tub and separate shower, very roomy. The lights are dimmable over the tub which was great to relax in after long days of sightseeing. The beds were okay for me. I was able to sleep, but not as well as I would like to on vacation. There was a full closet, bathrobes, and ample dresser space. A very roomy room. Also the electric shades were a cool touch. I found the staff of the Grand Hyatt Seattle to be friendly and obliging. The location of the hotel is a BIG plus. We walked to the Public Market almost everyday of our four day stay. Shopping is nearby and so is the monorail to the Seattle Center where they have the Space Needle, the Experience Music Project, and Science Fiction Museum. Good restaurants are also in walking distance and so is the Columbia Tower observation deck and Seattle Library. The only reason we rented a car was because we were taking a road trip to Olympic National Park and then heading down to Portland, OR. Overall it was a great stay and I would definitely return to the Grand Hyatt Seattle for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: MegDNC
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at -- on par with a Ritz Carlton, but at 1/3 the price. This is coming from a very experienced, picky, detail-oriented traveler. I honestly could not rate it any higher. *Very* highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Service Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Ratzilla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this hotel for only 1 night after our week long Alaskan Cruise and we received better service at the hotel than on the ship!! We arrived at 9am over Labor Day weekend. We weren't immediately allowed to check in understandable especially since there was a gaming convention going on around the corner. We received a call on our cell a short time later letting us know our room was ready. The hotel was holding our luggage and since there wasn't anyone to gather our luggage right then, they brought it up. Now I don't know if they did this just so we tipped the bellboy. I was ok with this. Jaz, the bellboy, said everything right! He asked if he had any questions with the room and if he could do anything for us. When we checked out, he told said "See you next time!" The phase spoke volumes to me! This hotel is less than 3 blocks from the Link (light rail) 40 min trip to SEA Pac airport, which is a very clean and easy to use system. Less than a block away is Von's a $3.50 Martini Bar, the atmosphere was great, laid back, and had outdoor seating. It's a fabulous hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelMpls
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, convienent to Pike Market and Waterfront. There were many restaurants in the area to choose from (within walking distance). How bad can it be when you see that your hometown baseball team was staying there. Beds comfortable...slept really well for being away from home. They were very helpful the next morning getting us transportation to the cruise dock. We would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Stay at the Grand Hyatt Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Normlee
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable upscale hotel only 3 blocks from the Link Light Railâ€™s Westlake Station, an inexpensive and easy connection to SeaTac Airport, less than 40 minutes away. Three weeks ago, we stayed 3 nights when Seattle is not wet but surprisingly foggy two mornings and cold all 3 nights AND this is the middle summer. The biggest plus is its location, 7 blocks to Pike Place Market and Pike Place Chowder, only 2 blocks to the Washington State Convention Center, and an exercising 14 blocks walk to the Space Needle but a monorail trip back to the Westlake Station (or catch the monorail to the Space Needle also). The check-in was smooth and quick and the room was adequate for its price range. The standard marble bathroom, separate tub (with a foot wash) and shower, is larger than a Bellagio standard bathroom. The maid service was adequate, always enough towels, but no evening bed fold and chocolate. The hotel has a Starbucks, a convenience. It was interesting to see at least a Starbucks, a Seattleâ€™s Best, or a non-chain coffee haven on almost every downtown street. As AAA members, we had â€œfreeâ€� breakfasts in Ruthâ€™s Chris Steak House in a corner of the hotel. The corn beef hash with egg; a ham, mushroom, and cheese omelet; and an American Breakfast (eggs, ham, toast, potatoes and fruit) were very good. The only disappointment was a simple croissant breakfast as the croissant was too soft and gummy. We did not try the hotel's other 2 restaurants since, within 3 blocks walking distance, there were much more (safe) choices, for example, The Cheesecake Factory, Rock Bottom, or P.F. Chang. The was no downside to our stay except for a minor missed complimentary newspaper. Before breakfast, a friendly front desk person explained that the complimentary newspaper service is requested, usually at check-in, and entered into the hotel delivery system. The hotel would delivery a newspaper later that day or we can pick one up at the help desk. After breakfast, a help desk person saw us leaving Ruthâ€™s Chris restaurant and eagerly rushed to a back room, quickly returned, and handed us a thick Sunday newspaper BEFORE we asked. He anticipated, an excellent trait, and offered excellent service! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Decor”
Reviews.Author: Napanut
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a business trip from Seattle. We had a choice between Grand Hyatt or Sheraton. Decided to stay at Hyatt and was very pleased. Rooms were clean, the view was beautiful and the service was great. Was heading to dinner and was going to get a cab when the bellmen asked if I was headed to dinner and told him "yes", he asked where I was headed and told him Salty's. He told me to wait about 10 minutes and to come back. I listened and when I returned, their was a streach limo waiting for me and my friend. The bellman knew that the resteraunt had a car service for free and went out of his way to call them so we can go in style. That to me is above and beyond. He could have just whistled for a cab, but no, he went and called the restaurant for us and got us a limo. Fantastic. To top it off, the driver was very informative, polite and gave us a scenic tour and took us back to the hotel after our dinner. This was a great night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I was tired when I reached this hotel after an arrival on the Victoria Clipper. Check-in was easy and fast. The receptionist was warm and friendly. She told me about dining options in the hotel and in the area and told me that they would be happy to help me during my stay and seemed to genuinely mean it. I was very pleased with my room which had a view of the harbor. It took me a long time to locate the switch for the room darkening shades. They are electronic and the book in the room simply says the switch is on the wall--but what wall? The switch was behind the lamp on the bedside table with the radio.........after leaving my bags I walked downstairs to find something to eat. There is a Ruth Chris steak house that appeared to still be serving but the NY Deli was closing up. I walked across the street to the mall and had dinner at an Italian place there. It was very good but I do not recall name--il Fornio? The room was clean, nice TV, free internet to Passport members, nice amenities in the bathroom with deep soaking tub and separate shower, No complaints. There were magazines in the room to read which I appreciated. Breakfast in the Club Lounge the next morning was disappointing. I had eaten breakfast in Marriott concierge lounges most every morning the week before and had been pleased. Breakfast here was very skimpy--three or four choices of cold cereal, some pastries, smoked salmon, cheese and capers. Nothing hot except coffee. There were two choices of Greek yogurt--honey or pomegranate. Check-out was easy. I used award points for the stay so can't say much about value. I prefer this property to the Hyatt on Olive and 8.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel. Great staff too!”
Reviews.Author: PoorTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one evening pre-cruise in June. I had contacted the hotel ahead of time to make my request for a room with a view as it was a special trip. They gave us the best room in our category as far as I could tell. It was a corner room. Decorated lovely and we had the most spectacular view. In addition every staff member we met was happy and friendly. The hotel is in a great location as well. I would love to stay here again when in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good views. Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: stevenr35
Reviews.Content: Was here for 5 days on business. Great room (not overly large) huge bathroom. Nice smellies in bathroom. Good TV, good gym, great breakfast. Really helpful staff. Hotel is in a good location of Seattle too. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: SouthAussieDave
Reviews.Content: We only had the one night stay in Seattle as stop over on our 4 week US/Canada holiday. As it was only for the night we thought we would treat ourselves to a bit of luxury and so glad we booked the Hyatt. From the moment you walk in to the place you are made to feel welcome. All of our questions (which I am sure they have heard a thousand times before) were answered to the full. We booked direct with the hotel and asked for a corner room with a view. Our room on the 17th floor was one of the best hotel rooms we have stayed in. Luxurious bathroom and a nice sitting area with a view. Our bedroom looked straight down the street to Pike Place market and the bay. (see photos). Our wifi was free so maybe it makes a difference booking direct - not sure. Almost cancelled our Amtrak booking for the next morning just to stay another night or two in luxury. Thank you to the Hyatt for making our short stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Masterpiece Maintains Maximum Moxie”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: Well, I am writing this while drinking red wine so that may color my review, but this hotel is freakin' awesome. On this second visit, we booked the Emerald Suite after my return from a year in Iraq. We were checked into room 3015, the highest and prettiest suite in the hotel. What can I say? It was the largest and most comfortable suite we have stayed in at any hotel. The view of the Olympic peninsula and the city were flawless and the bed was outstanding. The towels could use some refreshing, but that is the only nit to pick. What a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: labern116
Reviews.Content: Hotwire price - $160/night included taxes. Room was small but bathroom was large. Great location. Wireless was not free. Deli next door to starbucks was good for sandwiches. Took the train from the airport for $2.50 to Nordstrom and then walked 2 blocks. Walked to Pikes Market and down by piers. Took a bus tour around the city. Highly recommend. Driver gave a good tip to take the ferry for $6.50 round trip to Bainbridge and good view of the city. Took the Amtrak train to Portland. Nice ride.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benfbrown
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews of this hotel are quite accurate. It rates as one of the best we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Modern elegance. Beautiful rooms and ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: alm3d8
Reviews.Content: Two adults and three children stayed in adjoining rooms. Got $98 price on priceline for each room - great bargain! Spacious and elegant. Wonderful staff. Close to sites.

Reviews.Title: “You're more than welcome. Sort of.”
Reviews.Author: kjkToronto
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline for five nights. Doorman and bellhops were super helpful and friendly. Check in was easy. Room was pretty nice but not that much better than rooms at say the Novotel or Courtyard Marriot in Toronto. King sized bed was nice but I found the sheets kind of annoying, as they came loose very easily during the night. The bathroom was probably the highlight - it was huge. Shower probably had room for 3-4 people, separate tub. Very nice. Powered black out shades were neat, and the comfy chair with foot stool was appreciated. Hot tub was a welcome relaxation at the end of our week. Fitness room seemed very nice. Cons - We kind of felt like the Clampett's arriving in Beverly Hills a few times walking around in our grubby jeans etc. (More with some of the the main desk staff and a general impression. ) Perhaps that was just me being self conscious, I don't know. Concierge was super knowledgeable and gave us great info when asked specific questions, but did not really volunteer enough info when asked a broader question. Biggest con for me was the lack of free wireless. Seriously? The Starbucks downstairs, Barnes and Noble, and the mall across the street can all give it away for free but apparently not the Hyatt. Welcome to the 2000s... This seems to be the case at many upper range hotels, along with things like $1 local phone calls (which we wouldn't have had to make if we'd had wi-fi...), over the top ppv movie charges, and offering to rent you a fridge since the paid mini bar can't be emptied. The business center computer required a credit card to activate it. One of these things would be fine, but the combination of all of them just feels... Miserly. I loved the hotel and the high end touches, but these little things make me inclined to forfeit the luxury in favour of of usefulness at a cheaper hotel. If I had paid full price for the room I would have been seriously pissed instead of just irritated. If these seem nitpicky to you, then the Hyatt was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Darn it!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom3under6
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that my husband and I looooove this hotel. It has everything that you could want in a hotel. We stayed last year for our anniversary and the staff was amazing and we had more than a wonderful stay. This year though...darn it...we traveled with our small children and I was stressed the entire time. Ugh! We arrived around 3:00 pm and got to our room quickly. Perfect. Next, we put our little ones down for a nap. Here's the problem. If you are a parent with small children and you value nap time, this hotel is not the place. You could hear so much noise outside our doors. The banging of doors, the people walking by, and housekeeping. We struggled to get them to go down because each time they would almost get there, there would be a big bang or the person doing the housekeeping would make some noises in the hall. I was sitting in the bathroom reading my book (where else could I go while they were napping? LOL) and I could seriously hear the person next door going to the restroom. Yikes! Because I could hear all these noises, I knew that our neighbors would be able to hear our kids...that's the part that stressed me out the most...trying to keep them quiet so they didn't bother anyone else. We stuffed some towels in the crack under the door to keep some of the noise out, but it didn't work too well. We thought ahead to bring our own fan for some white noise, but even this didn't help much. I guess another issue would be that we didn't have a fridge or a microwave that we could use for our little guy's milk. I had to go down to Starbucks each time and buy some heated milk. $2 each time. Spendy! If you aren't traveling with small kids, these issues will mean nothing to you because most adults don't need naps at 3 pm nor have to worry about keeping beverages warm or cold. Would we stay there again.? If it's just hubby and I...in a heart beat. If we need a place to stay when we are traveling with our kids....ohhhhh....I don't know. I might risk it just because we love the hotel so much.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Grand Hyatt Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Piqua41
Reviews.Content: Huge 2-room suite for $215/night - who can argue with that (at least in Seattle)? Great location, good workout room, Ruth's Chris Steak House on premises, just steps away from Westlake Center and Pacific Center, monorail to Space Needle, Pike Place Market, etc. For $2.50 and in 40 mins., you can ride a brand spanking new light rail train to/from SEATAC airport that lands you 2-3 blocks from the Hyatt. Smart and eager to please front desk staff and concierge. As for restaurants, you can't go wrong with virtually any place at Pike Place Market, including the Alibi Room bar/pub underneath the market, Pike Place Chowder at the market, and Etta's near the market. Fantastic. Every possible cuisine is covered. Also, take the Savor Seattle foodie lovers' walking tour of the Pike Place Market. Well worth the $42. Dining at the Space Needle restaurant was surprisingly good, and for an offbeat attraction, walk around the Olympic Sculpture Park north of Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mtnelson
Reviews.Content: I came to the Grand Hayatt for a conference. The staff was the rudest that I have ever encountered. This is not worth the money and I will never stay at the Hayatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Great high class, swanky hotel; could offer more free amenities”
Reviews.Author: JR_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here with my wife. Very modern and high class hotel. We got our reservation via priceline. Check in was fast and easy. We had room 2101. Room was very modern. There was a desk area and a sofa chair. Desk area could use more electrical outlets. Had to move the desk to get to a free outlet to connect my laptop. Also found the desk chair to be very uncomfortable. King size bed was a little on the firm side for me, but still comfortable. The room did not offer any free wifi or wired internet. The room also didn't have a mini-fridge. You could have one sent up for an additional fee. Ice machines are not on each floor. The room had a safe where you could store your laptop and other valuables. There are many food options located within walking distance. There is a Ruth Chris steak house located in the lobby of the hotel. There is a also a sushi place located around the corner (accessible via hotel lobby), as well as a Cheesecake Factory. Valet parking costs $39. Lots of high class amenities such as a visual light do not disturb sign, motorized curtains, alarm clock with ipod dock. Bathroom was very big, with stand up shower and bathtub. Would definitely stay here again, for a good price. Wished hotel offered more free amenities such as free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Harmony177
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and clean. Staff is friendly. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kcr02
Reviews.Content: We rented a Corner Suite room and it was amazing. Great view, two tvs (although we didn't have time to watch any). The customer service was phenominal. From the front desk person, bell boy, concierge, room service, etc., everyone was GREAT. Only complaint? You couldn't store anything in the mini-fridge.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: OOBDC
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt hotel is, in my opinion, one of, if not the best hotel in downtown Seattle. The entire hotel is nicely appointed, clean, well decorated and in great shape (although it is still relatively new). The common areas are spacious and inviting. There are always several hotel staffers in view to assist you with whatever you might need. The rooms are large, well appointed, comfortable and have very nice, spacious bathrooms. They are also very quiet. The hotel is located in a very convenient part of downtown Seattle (so if you don't have to drive, don't). The valet parking (I believe the only parking option) is quick and efficient. I really like this hotel and strongly recommend it. In this interest of full disclosure, there are a couple of things that folks may find irksome. One, no free Internet (unless you are a member of Hyatt's rewards program), although, for some reason, higher star level hotels always seem to charge for this. There is only one on site restaurant, a connected Ruth's Chris steakhouse that also has a small lounge area (there are several fine restaurants and bars within two blocks of the hotel). The rooms have the mini bar in the refrigerator and if any items are moved, you are charged for them. Also, I ordered an in room movie during my stay and the picture quality was not good. The charge was promptly deleted from my bill at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albuq1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. Great location, beautiful clean rooms and amazing bathroom. Rooms have an ipod sound dock so I just plugged my ipod in and relaxed. The beds are so comfy and the bathrobe in the room is a nice touch. I wished they had free WIFI but across the street is a Barnes and Noble where you can check email for free.

Reviews.Title: “Suite a fabulous deal”
Reviews.Author: cindyvWeston_Ct
Reviews.Content: Our family needed a larger accommodation in Seattle and wanted space to entertain for a family reunion. The Executive suite was spacious and gracious. It had plenty of room for two rollaways (no extra charge) for our daughters which easily stored out of the way when we needed to use the living room. The extra bathroom really came in handy as well. This room is stunning, with gorgeous bathrooms and zen-like decorating. At $273 a night, this beat two regular rooms hands down. The location could not have been more accessible or convenient to the Public Market and all shopping. Starbucks or the Deli are much better alternatives for breakfast than Ruth Chris. Go to Serious Pie for the pizza of your life, it is worth the wait and Nutella crumpets at the Crumpet Shop is a unique treat for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rosagordo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year on a vacation to Seattle. I had booked a god deal through expedia and ended up paying only $125 a night. That is a good value considering the location of the hotel to the event locations I was seeing. Also for the comfortable room with a huge marble walk in shower fit for a king! The jacuzzi tub in the room was so fabulous I really didnt want to leave the bathroom! The concierge was very knowlegable and helpful. I needed a little extra because I usually find seattle notoriously hard to navigate. I would like to come stay there again. Good work Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay with marble bathroom”
Reviews.Author: artist81
Reviews.Content: This was my 14th day with Hyatt this year. The other 13 were for business. This hotel room was just great. The bathroom has a marvelous soaking tub plus a glassed in shower. Parking is $28/night. You can park on 15th Avenue ( make sure you are not in a zoned spot) and catch a #10 bus to the hotel. It will stop across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: JoeCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an "Executive Suite" which was beautiful in every way. It had a nice, separate sitting room with bar area and separate bathroom. The bedroom was nice with a walk-in closet and make-up area. The main bathroom was beautiful with a large tub and separate shower. The staff was very professional. The only problem was the noise from traffic was somewhat loud. I sleep deeply, but my partner does not. If it wasn't for the noise, I would rate this hotel excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: VcrBC_skier
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bellevue Hyatt numerous times but decided to stay in downtown Seattle on this trip. We liked: 1. the room - good size, huge bathroom, very clean 2. the location - close to shops, restaurants, Seattle Center, waterfront 3. the staff - very helpful, friendly and responsive We disliked: 1. no free WiFi so could not use my ITouch 2. not very sound proof 3. not allowed to use the mini fridge 4. ice machine on another floor 5. only 2 bath towels in the room Overall, this is a very nice hotel with great staff but management seems to be cutting out some little things that would make the overall experience much better. I would recommend this hotel to friends but with some concerns.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best Hotels I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: BD_FDNY
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here on the night before and the night after a cruise from Seattle. On arriving the first night, , the bell svcs promptly took our bags, and we had quite a few. They directed us to Lily at the front desk who was very attentive and realized we were there to start our honeymoon, took EXCELLENT care of us and even sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne. The room was amazing. It was super clean, it had a great view of downtown Seattle, the bathroom had a great tub and shower and also extremely clean. And the beds were very relaxing. On the night after the cruise, we were only able to book a 2 queen bed room at the time of booking due to the hotel being booked. Somehow, between Lily working her magic the first night, and the other young woman working hers the day we arrived back, not only were we able to get a king bed, but we were able to check in early after coming from a cruise. You do pay for quality. But the extra attention to detail on both stays is worth the extra money. The best example of that was the doorman? I am sure he introduced himself but I am bad with names. He on the other hand, remembered us. And i don't mean from the night before to the next day. I mean from the 1 minute we spoke as we loaded our bags when we left for our cruise, he remembered us when we pulled up a week later. The hotel itself is great, but the service.... puts it over the top!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vanha10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and 6 and 3 year old kids. I was recieved exceptionally well at the reception by Lily S. who made me feel welcomed and went above and beyond by ordering some milk and cookies for my kids since we arrived late (Very nice touch). The rooms were spacious enough and the bathroom was exceptional. Very clean and well maintained and central to all locations. Only suggestion I would have is to allow free internet access for Gold passport members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flbjaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel wa wonderful. The staff were very helpful and made our stay great. The room was big and very clean. The noise level was ok. You did hear some doors slamming and some talking in the hallways. The hotel is located in the center of everything and easy to get around. Great views and would stay again. Beware of extra charges such as parking, internet, and the minibar. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in May and would recommend the hotel. The location is good, central for most places and transport links. Check-in was painless and the guy taking our bags up to the room was polite and courteous and showed us the gadgets of the room and warned us about the silly mini-bar with its sensor mechanism (very handy when travelling with children who may just move things around and you will still get charged for it). The room was nice with a separation between the bedroom and lounge area, and the bathroom a good size and power-shower. We did not use the gym or restaurant but did find the starbucks downstairs very helpful for caffeine fixes and it was open quite late too. It is rather a big hotel and whilst we were there, lots of conferences going on which made it feel quite business-like. All-in-all it is a safe bet for a stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: miltraveler1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at a discounted rate and expected to get a low-floor room with a view of some alley, but when I checked in, I got a room on the 24th floor (one floor below club level) and a view of the Space Needle and the Bay. All the staff were very nice and it seemed genuine. The room was very clean and the room service was fast. I really liked staying here much better than at the Pan Pacific. The location is great as well. The ONLY things I did not like were the shower amenities- the soap, shampoo etc. smelled like poison, but I am not a fan of ginger smell anyway, and the internet was not free. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cadence8
Reviews.Content: I came for a conference, paid $30 for an upgrade to a corner suite (when reserving), well worth it. Living room, separate bedroom, large bathroom and closet. Great location at the east side of downtown by convention center, near the freeway, light rail to the airport (and underground stations for downtown buses), and Capitol Hill. Room was quiet, clean; internet $9.95 a day. Hotel was modern decor, lots of wood, pleasant atmosphere. Ruth Chris is in the lobby, very good for lunch (didn't have breakfast or dinner there, so many other good choices nearby). Would definitely consider staying here again (though I'm a SPG Platinum elite).

Reviews.Title: “Would give it a 4, but zero soundproofing makes it a 2 or 3”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel. Many ameneties including an excellent workout room. The location is one block from the conv center, 2 blocks from the tram to the Space Needle, and maybe 5 blocks to Pike Market. Centrally located to everything - shopping, restaurants. The room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. The problem with this hotel is noise. You expect noise in any hotel, but these walls are so thin and so poorly sound insulated it's worse than a cheap travel motel. I could hear conversations from MULTIPLE rooms. The doors slam louder than any hotel I can remember. I sleep pretty well, but I was awakened continuously every night for 4 nights. There are a lot of good choices in downtown Seattle, so I will look around next time for a better selection. Also, at this rate, free internet or breakfast would have been nice. Last, the in-room coffee maker was hidden away in a drawer - almost like they didn't want you to find it (there is a Starbucks in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: RipTideChaser
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in downtown Seattle. I was there for a conference. Hotel banquet staff was great. The banquet food was excellent. Presentation was awesome. I also ate the at Ruths Chris steakhouse (adjacent to the hotel), also excellent (HIGHLY RECOMMEND). Hotel staff was very friendly. Room was plush and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: CatherineH86
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Seattle, was clean, has gorgeous rooms and was within walking distance to just about everything.The girl who checked us in, Hana, was so nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Cold, Convention Style Hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: Granted, our 1 night stay was a Sun. night but we found this hotel to have no warmth or charm leaving us with a mediocre impression of our first visit to Seattle. We have status SPG, HHonors and Marriott status so we are not opposed to corporate hotels but the Seattle Grand Hyatt made us wish we had chosen a different location. First, it must be attached to the convention center somehow because the signage and entrance in relation to an overpass/overhead parking structure made the hotel difficult to find. We had to drive around the block a few times and call the front desk to find the unobtrusive check-in location. Lobby is large and expansive.....and in our case, empty and cold. Even though the hotel was obviously under-occupied, there was no movement on an upgrade without a $100 fee. We were 2 adults and 2 teens and in a room with 2 double (not queen) beds. Front desk staff was robotic. The bathroom was huge and clean but the room was very cramped. Bedding and upholstery were warn and in need of updating. Location was good with much of the city within walking distance. We chose to do self park but the savings turned out to be only a few $ and it did not allow in/out privileges so I would recommend the valet instead. Breakfast was at Ruth's Chris and the service was horrendous even though we were the only ones in the place. $80 for breakfast left us completely unsatisfied. We left the Grand Hyatt wishing we had chosen a different hotel to get to know Seattle and U of Washington.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DDatYVR
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club Level room in April and found the hotel met all expectations of a Grand Hyatt. Standard King-sized room comes with a spacious marble bathroom with separate shower and tub. Only complaint was the lack of water pressure. Service was wonderful at the hotel. The concierge was responsive and provided great directions. The cleaning staff could be a little over-zealous, coming to our door at 9 a.m. Even after asking them to come back in an hour, they returned within half an hour asking for entry. Definitely remember to put on the "Do Not Disturb" signal. The Club lounge on the 27th floor was very convenient with breakfast - cut fruits and berries, assortment of pastries and breads, toast, smoked salmon, cereals and yogurt - included. Complimentary coffee and soft drinks are available throughout the day. In the evening, there's a nice spread of hors d'oeuvres - selection of breads/crackers, dips, cheese, crudites and marinated vegetables. Wine, beer and cocktails are available for purchase at very reasonable prices; a glass of good quality wine is $4. The hotel is conveniently located. Steps from great shopping and easily within walking distance of all the sights, you likely won't need your car much. Valet parking is expensive, totaling almost $40 per night. If you don't mind walking, there's plenty of cheaper parking lots in the area, particularly on weekends when minimal flat rates apply.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt not up to the their usual standards, time for some deep cleaning.”
Reviews.Author: Boughey3
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle quite often. Nice location, usually excellent service, and very clean. We recommend it to everyone, but this time we were highly disappointed and are considering staying somewhere else for next time.
