It started with a few small things that we just wanted to let go (more hassle to mention them). The couch had crusty food on the arm that was very obvious and needed to be steam cleaned (gross), the couches also are getting to the point where I think it's time to replace them. Also, there were some stains on the carpet and a splatter on the wall where someone spilled some type of drink. The next day we noticed that the desk roll-out chair had spills down both sides of the arms (coffee?), and some nasty smudges on the windows. The reason I'm taking the time to write this review is that for $250 a night, this shouldn't happen. Also, whenever we've had a problem at the Hyatt their customer service is top-notch, but no so this time. Unfortunately I didn't mention any of this until check-out (we were busy!) and the response I received was lackluster at best. The person at the front desk scribbled one of the things I told her on a note pad and looked at me like I was crazy. Maybe she thought I was telling her that I had done these things? I'm not sure. But she said she would pass it on to the housekeeping staff and that was it. No apology or acting like it was a problem. Maybe a meal coupon or something for next time to make up for it? But nothing. Maybe we've been spoiled, but we were very disappointed and will try a new hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sclark30
Reviews.Content: Two things keep me from giving the Grand Hyatt five stars: my bed was not very comfortable, and so my sleep quality was not good, and even on the 27th floor I could still hear noise from the street. Otherwise, the hotel is beautiful and quiet, with wonderful small touches, like each elevator has its own separate light so that you know where to stand before the doors open as an elevator reaches your floor. The white ginger soap from their spa smells great, and my corner suite was roomy and comfortable with great views of downtown Seattle and Puget Sound in the distance. I had several occasions to interact with staff, and in each instance the staff member was courteous and helpful. Room service was prompt, and the meal was hot; unfortunately the roast chicken was so salty I almost couldn't eat it. The fitness center is by far the best I have experienced in all my travels, with approximately 12 high-end weight machines and treadmills with their own TV screens. It was spacious and luxurious with wood paneling and earth tones--made me want to work out! Internet service in the room and in the business center is fee-based, so I didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: carnalismocc
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property recently and had an amazing experience! In order to have more room, we decided to book an Executive Suite being that we had the kids with us (9-year-old and 1-year-old.) We took advantage of their Gas Card Package which included valet parking and a $25 gas card for a rate of $284 per night. It's not cheap, but well worth the extra cost! The suite was very spacious, and had an amazing master bath! The views were great being on the 27th floor too! The location is excellent, and we were able to walk to just about everywhere we needed to go. There's great shopping, restaurants, Pike Place Market and the waterfront all within walking distance. The staff were all great, and the service couldn't have been better. I'll definitely be recommending this place to both family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Hotels Ever”
Reviews.Author: jharve
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is truly on of the best hotels I have stayed at...and I have stayed at The Trump! My room was very large and so comfortable. Large bathroom that was so clean and nicely stocked. Very professional and helpful staff. Great room service...especially the Corned Beef Hash for breakfast. Wonderful hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Denise70
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Seattle Grand Hyatt several times now ... & we just keep coming back! It has so many pluses, it's hard to remember them all. First of all, it's easy to get to & when you pull up to their door, you are greeted by friendly, helpful staff. A doorman takes your bag & helps you to the desk, and a valet takes your car keys. The lobby is nothing special & I'm sorry to admit that neither is the bar or restaurant, Ruth Chris. I mean, they aren't bad ... they just aren't extraordinary, either. Why do I keep going back? Great location -- in the heart of downtown, surrounded by fabulous shopping, restaurants, nightlife, the Convention Ctr, an incredible day spa, concert hall, theaters. And the rooms and bathrooms? The best in Seattle. The bathrooms are incrdible. Marble, granite, soaking tubs, large seperate showers, plush robes, wonderful lighting. The space is simply amazing, inviting, plush, elegant. The entry doors are the most beautiful wood ... & the rooms actually have doorbells. I had to chuckle w/ that amenity. The beds are quite comfortable, the linens fine, the draperies are electric. So you can open the drapes in the morning to see the sunrise without leaving your bed (I chuckled at that one, too!). Large picture windows & some rooms have spectacular views over the sound. This hotel is simply wonderful & the one time the reservation was screwed up (we booked it online, the hotel's website), they bent over backwards to make it right. If you're looking for a great hotel in downtown, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “First class!!”
Reviews.Author: DominicanDavid
Reviews.Content: Great location, fully stocked bar, plenty of staff at bar, restaurant and check in counter, every employee was really nice; even the valet guys!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as expected”
Reviews.Author: buckley_girl98
Reviews.Content: Service is top notch at this establishment as well as the rooms. I have stayed in their basic room overlooking the roof of another building, as well as a room that was a suite, on an upper floor that overlooks the entire city. In all of the rooms I have stayed in the bathroom has been the same...excellent! The shower has a glass surrounding door. If you like to take baths, there is a soaking tub on the other side of the bathroom. The company I work for used this hotel to host one of our meetings last year. A lot of the same staff was still there this year, when we utilized them again, ready to take care of our every need. The location is great too if you are in town to shop or enjoy the nightlife. You can walk to a lot of Seattle Hot Spots. There are a couple of restaurants on site and most importantly a "Starbucks" which I loved! As with any downtown hotel you will have to wait for your car in valet, but in my experience, they will have it to you, within 10 minutes tops! Fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT HOTEL!!! I have stayed at this hotel a few times now and each time I enjoy it more and more. This is a newer hotel with a great location, great staff and great design.

Reviews.Title: “A topnotch hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaflyer3M
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt property is one of the best. The staff members are well-informed, courteous and helpful. The rooms are excellent, with a wonderful layout of seating, desk, bed and bath. There are many choices of excellent hotels in Seattle, but I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Rude & Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: RZ001
Reviews.Content: For a birthday gift my boyfriend received a room at the Hyatt from his father, who had won an overnight stay at a recent auction for a local charity. During this stay we were treated like outcasts. Unfortunately, I was unable to check in with my boyfriend early in the evening but at that time he was immediately downgraded from an executive level suite. During the time there we had a couple of friends with him coming over before dinner, to quietly enjoy the sauna. We were extremely polite and never disruptive. My boyfriend and I returned to the hotel later that evening and had a terrific time. The room was nice and the bathroom was beautiful, as people in our mid 20's we don't often have the opportunity to enjoy such lovely accommodations. However we were still disappointed about our downgrade, as it was a charitable donation of most likely more than the room we ended up staying in is actually worth. The part of our stay that made us the most uncomfortable was when the valet staff went to pick up my boyfriend's truck. He is a hard working landscaper and with a messy work truck he depends on to get around. I understand it isn't an audi or a mercedes, either way it is his car and we wanted to get home. After waiting for nearly 20 minutes and watching about 15 or so other cars come in and leave with guests, we were finally attended to. At that time the staff didn't even know what had happened to his key. Fortunately, one gentleman was very courteous and tried to hunt it down. When the truck finally arrived, a young guy pulled it up to the side of the street, where I would have to get into the truck in traffic. He didn't speak a word to us, and my boyfriend who is probably one of the most generous tippers gave him nothing. My point for writing all of this is not to receive compensation or anything, but just to make a point. I have worked in the hospitality industry off and on in order to get myself through college and survive at times for about 10 years. I understand that management at upscale facilities wants to cater to those with money, after all they are the ones usually spending the most, but I also know that a lot of the most generous, kind and hard working individuals make this city a place that people want to visit. I was approached by a manager one time to treat a customer extremely well because he was worth $3B. At that time I turned to him and said I will treat him just like I treat everyone else who walks through this door, with respect and kindness and I did. As a matter of fact they were one of my most rude people I had ever served and ended up spending way less than the awkward guy in the corner with a T-shirt on who tipped me almost 40%. It makes no difference what you look like or what car you drive, we are all hard working, educated people just trying to make something of ourselves. In the future unless clients are rude to you, please don't be rude to them because in reality you know nothing about them. Kindness and hospitality go a long way, and in the end will make your business much more profitable. I don't know where I will be in 10 years from now, hopefully successful and somewhat wealthy, but I do know for certain I will not be staying at the Hyatt in Downtown Seattle ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gktmd2
Reviews.Content: I am a big Hyatt fan. I ususally stay at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle. We decided to try this one. It is well located around Bellevue Square. There are great restaurants within a short walkign distance. The shoping centers are close, including the Bravern which has high end retailers out of my price range. Bellevue Square is right across the street. The hotel is huge but they maintain a small hotel service level. The Regency CLub room is new and the food was very good. They charge about 5 dollars for drinks. The workout room is across the street and very nice though there is no sauna or steam room, at least that I could find. I like the self park, which is free on the weekends. The valet charges at large city hotels really bothers me. Overall it was very nice and well worth the reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the country”
Reviews.Author: bw331
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seattle soon after it opened about 8-9 years ago. I remember loving the hotel. It was new and modern and in a great location and ever since I've always loved it. I recently revisited it and was worried that it could now be showing its age. I'm happy to report that these worries were completely unfounded, the hotel is still amazing. There's a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse in the hotel, as well as a Starbucks and a sushi restaurant. The staff is very helpful. And the location is great for anything in downtown Seattle, either business or pleasure. But my favorite part of the Grand Hyatt Seattle are the rooms. They are modern and I just love the layout of them. As others have reported, the bathrooms are huge, and the whole entry area of the room has stone floors instead of carpet. The views from the upper floors are also amazing, especially on an unusual clear day. I had room service twice and each time it was good and came quickly. Overall, it's a great hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: This location is great - very walkable for both business and going out to dinner, or to see local attractions. The lobby is nothing to write home about, so don't expect a hopping social scene or anything. The hotel itself is quite impeccable - from linens to cleanliness. A plush bed and lots of pillows make it comfy. Check-in was super fast and personable, and cabs are plentiful at the hotel's taxi stand to get anywhere quickly. Quiet hotel as well, which is always important. I had room service once - the menu was not huge, but for hotel food was above average. But you're in Seattle - may as well get out of the hotel and eat anyway! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in rainy weather”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia8002
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days in the middle of November and enjoyed every moment. My room was one of the corner suites and I'm sure the view of the mountains would have been great if it hadn't rained the entire time (not that I expected anything else from Seattle in November!). The suite consists of two rooms and you enter into the sitting room w/ a television and work desk. Walk down a short hallway to the bedroom and pass the bathroom on one side and closets on the other. Another review did mention that the bedroom space is tight, and I definitely agree. However, the bathroom is large and spacious, and given the extra space in the sitting room, I didn't really need a huge bedroom. I used the Hyatt exercise facilities and they were fantastic although very crowded when I went at 6:30 am one morning (empty at 5:00 am another morning, go figure!). Room service was great and very quick - usually less than 30 minutes for both breakfast and dinner. There is a Starbucks attached to the hotel which I used for breakfast some mornings. Also, if you are going to the convention center and it is raining, there are awnings on the exterior of the hotel and neighboring buildings that provide plenty of coverage from the weather so you won't need to take the hotel-provided umbrella. It worked for me all three mornings I was in town.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chapopote
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in September 2009 during a business trip/conference, and I must say that it is a beautiful hotel! The bathrooms were to die for -- very spacious with a glass shower and a huge soaking tub. All of the bathroom amenities were top notch...thick towels, fragrant soap/shampoos, a plush robe...no detail was overlooked. I had a room with 2 double beds on one of the upper floors. I didn't have the best view, but I didn't spend that much time in my room, so it didn't really matter. The bed was spectacular, very comfortable with lots of pillows. The location was fantastic. It was short walk to most Seattle attractions -- Pike's Place Market, the harbor area --- and a quick cab or monorail ride to the Space Needle. Many good restaurants were also within walking distance. It would have been nice to have a slightly less pricey restaurant associated with the hotel -- we never did dine at Ruth Chris' Steakhouse. We also had a continental breakfast provided each morning at the conference, so I didn't actually dine at the restaurant for breakfast either. A Starbucks was attached to the hotel, so getting my morning caffeine was never a problem. The only thing I would comment on as a negative was the outrageous price to park at the hotel. With taxes and other fees, it came to around $40 per night. (I was also charged $5 for the hotel having to accept a Fed Ex package for me...what's that all about?) Other than that, the hotel was very comfortable and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm!”
Reviews.Author: myparis2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights during a business/leisure trip. Its proximity to shops is unbeatable. I; however, find that Seattle has better hotels for me and therefore I may never stay at Hyatt again. Its lack of proper lobby and lounge is something you will notice as soon as you arrive. If you want to have a coffee or drink in the evening, the lounge is non-existent. There is nothing inside the hotel. They tell you to order room service instead. There is a steakhouse attached to the hotel if you want a full meat meal but that's it. So, nice rooms, great location, weak amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Personal Miracle”
Reviews.Author: Marblegirl40
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, our dinner at Urbane was perfect. The next morning, after a beautiful walk to the market, I dressed for a family wedding, putting on an heirloom ring. After checking out, I noticed my ring had slipped off my finger and was no where to be found. Pressed for time, I told the desk staff, who were very responsive, but still I held out little hope, and was heartsick at being so careless. Nine days later, I was informed that my ring had been turned in by a very honest housekeeper. I wonder if there's anything that contributes more to a hotel's success than quality staff-thank you Seattle Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel. Great location, and fantastic rooms for price”
Reviews.Author: merri175
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. We checked in late one night and all staff were fantastic. We had a great view of the Space Needle from our room which was fun, but the blackouts blinds and totally sound proof room really made the difference. The location is great; it is a short walk from everything. The room was incredible, everything we'd ever want. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom out of this world. The staff were always friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. Seattle is a great city, we loved it. It's relaxed and unpretentious but also full of interesting history and culture.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: CarlNova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in June - I made a three-day stop in Seattle during a cross country trip. Needless to say, the Grand Hyatt was one of the nicest hotels I experienced during my trip. The staff was GREAT, and the room, very clean and modern, had a great view. The bathrooms were very spacious and stylish. And, of course, the beds were very comfy. One extra highlight - having Ruth's Chris (lobby) for breakfast in the morning. What a way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy common areas, but good rooms”
Reviews.Author: TimfromLondon
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to see so many rave reviews here because although service is good and the rooms are high quality, the hotel lacks any character or flare and during a 12 day stay that was something I really noticed. The lobby is gloomy, the business centre is in a room as big as a cupboard. The bar is out of the way and uninviting. The lobby is also full of ovepowering piped music although this does seem to be acceptable to most. On the upside, the rooms are modern and comfortable and well equiped - ipod dock for example. The service is exemplary. If you're looking for an efficient, could be anywhere on the planet, business hotel then this is fine. I'm less surprised that the people at head office in Seattle say no-one plumps for the Hyatt on their second visit - but they head off for something with more character

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: mntravelfun
Reviews.Content: We had a regular room but it has one of the nicest hotel bathrooms I've seen. I was really impressed with the room. Everything was great. The location was also very central for tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great wine!”
Reviews.Author: plannit
Reviews.Content: Close to market place and fabulous restraunts and shopping! We recommend splurging the extra $50 a night on the regency club- you go up to exclusive area overlooking the city for light breakfast (fruit, sweet rolls, starbucks coffee/tea, cereals, yogurt), and orderves and drinks at happy hour. At $4 a glass of darn good cab, its worth it and the view is great. Orderves varied, our included cheeses, crab on crackers, salmon, hummis, and some little apple pie/tarts that were yummmmy! Club members also get free access to internet up there, which is great for booking your tours, checking emails and such. I could leave my laptop at home and make it on carryon for the weekend. This hotel is also like 2 blocks from the bus stop ($4 verses $44 for a taxi)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JH2020
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Comfortable beds, great location. I got a good rate through expedia. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good - but better doors needed for a quieter stay !”
Reviews.Author: aussiepax
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights on business recently. Nice staff and no fuss check in and excellent but pricey valet parking. Room was nice with very nice and more than spacious bathroom on club level. Overall a nice place. Considering that many travellers may have jet lag or keep odd hours, I was disappointed that the otherwise quiet location of my room on that floor was disturbed by corridor noise by other guests after midnight . The reason is that all the main doors of the guest rooms have quite a big gap under them (? reason) and the noise just heads on in. Most hotels in other cities have quite heavy and close fitting doors almost like fire doors , but this was not up to scratch. Other minor nuisances were more than usual noise from plumbing in adjacent rooms, and no room service after 12 midnight, which is poor at this level of establishment in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: DRDU
Reviews.Content: As for the couple that stayed in a corner room, yes the room is a little small with a sofa chair. But you have a double-wide closet where you can keep your bags in. The TV is perfectly set on top of the dresser. Double windows with auto shades that you controll in both rooms. A spacious livingroom that has a flat screen TV and bar refrig. If you want to store cool items, you can rent an extra one for $5/day. The bathroom is perfect that sits between both rooms along the hallway. We had problems with the young adult-teens next door and asked for hotel security to quiet them down at 2:30 in the morning. Next morning, we asked to be moved and the hotel manager gave us a beautiful suite, twice the size. It definitely made our vacation worthwhile. We also had access to the Club which is where we got our fresh grind coffee from 6am-9pm daily. The one cup coffee maker is not the real deal when it comes to drinking coffee. Otherwise, you can go down to the lobby and have Starbucks. When you check-in as a AAA member, make sure you tell them you want the breakfast coupons for Ruth Chris. They are worth up to $25 each so you can get up to a $50 breakfast for two. It's worth every penny. We tried to make reservations for dinner there but couldn't get in early before 8 pm because of the show "Wicked" booked that week. So we got a sit in the bar area during happy hour from 4-6pm and decided to have appetizers for $5 each along with our delicous red Cab wine called 14 Hands. OMG ! We ordered all five appetizers on the menu and doubled on the prime rib sliders. We ended up finding a wine store in town and bought six bottles of the 14 Hands wine @ $12 and packed it in our suitcases for our plane ride back. As for outside the hotel, be aware of your surroundings when you walk downtown. There are a lot of bums and peddlers everywhere. If you walk down to Pikes Place Market, stay on Pine street. On the backside of the hotel is Pikes street which has the convention center behind there. I wouldn't recommend going down that street to the Market because there seems to be more bums out there and don;t eat at Fox's on Pike street. Horrible food! Caddy corner to the hotel is a mall called Pacific Place where there is a movie on the top floor along with many restaurants. We recommend the Mexican restaurant. We didn't rent a car this time because our friend chauffeured us around, but if you eat at Ruth Chris, you can park there for six hours with validation but still have to pay $8. Otherwise. parking is expensive everywhere you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cleeclub
Reviews.Content: Spend a night pre-cruise and loved everything about the hotel. From the efficient check-in, to the wonderful room on the 21st floor with and amazing view of the bay and islands, the very comfy bed, large spacious bathroom and nice size flat screen tv. The automatic shades were a plus and the bathroom amenities were plentiful, even toothpaste. All this for a basic AAA rate! I was also impressed to receive an email the morning of our arrival to check-in per internet (check-out as well) and another email an hour later to let us know that our room was ready. The location is very good too, walking distance to most of Seattle's main tourist attractions, not to mention a great shopping area. We had a good night's rest in a completely quiet room and would definately stay at this Hyatt again on our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: reallaw46
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was a wonderful experience. The location is outstanding, within walking distance of the major shopping areas, Pike Market, the harbor and the monorail to the Space Needle. The room was very comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. This was one of the best hotel experiences we have had in recent years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bedroom area too small.”
Reviews.Author: enatal
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in downtown Seattle, It is perfectly located close to eateries, and attractions. We got there for three nights before a cruise. We got a corner standard room in the 7th floor. It included a living-room space with sofa and desk, a separate large bathroom, and the "bedroom" area. The bedroom area is too small and crammed, compared to the rest of the room. We brought three suitcases and two bags, we had a hard time being able to walk around the bedroom area without stumbling with the suitcases or room furniture. The flat panel TV was placed very high in top of a dresser, in an awkward position. The bathroom had a separate all-glass shower stall, really nice. The shower head was not adjustable, without the hand-held option, making hard to shower without getting your hair wet. Bath tub has no shower head, only a waterfall-type spout. View was to the roof of the meeting areas, and other hotel and office buildings, nothing panoramic. Motorized Window Shades a plus!. Otherwise, outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “This is the one...”
Reviews.Author: TheFalls
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a reasonably priced downtown hotel with a great location and wonderful rooms and service...this is the one. I paid $143.00 per night (AAA discount) for a beautiful club room. We wanted to see "Wicked" (the Paramount theater is only 2 blocks away) and it was sold out for the evening we wanted to attend. The concierge (thanks, Louise) was able to get us perfect seats in the club level of the theater. It was wonderful! We also had free breakfast vouchers for Ruth Chris restaurant within the hotel (again, AAA benefit) The breakfasts we had were the best on our whole trip. Wonderful staff at the Hyatt. Ladies will especially enjoy the bathrooms - big, soaking tubs. For the services, ammenities and price, this was an outstanding deal.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Robfur
Reviews.Content: Outstanding stay all-around. No complaints or issues to report of.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get much better.”
Reviews.Author: IdahoCoug
Reviews.Content: We had a corner suite on 23rd floor with views of bay and space needle. With the floor to ceiling windows it was like being in a postcard, especially at night. Staff was outstanding. Hotel is within walking distance of all downtown. If you only have a carryon, take the light rail to and from the airport. It's $2.50 a person and you get off at Westlake, 2 blocks from hotel. Best deal is happy hour at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse in the lobby. In the lounge you can get prime rib sliders for $5.95, outstanding!! The reviewer who mentioned no carafe, the coffee maker in the room is designed to just have the cup put below the spout so it's brewed into your coffe cup. The only problem we had was solved without our even asking. I ordered room service breakfast for myself and a carafe of coffee for my wife, they we're a little late and my wife decided to go shopping instead of wait for her coffee. I asked them to take the coffee back when my breakfast arrived, then when I called to have them remove the room service table, they told me they'd comped the whole breakfast since it was a little late. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “High standard”
Reviews.Author: TravelProNewYork
Reviews.Content: I have stayed other Hyatt in US,but this hotel is far better than other Hyatt. I know there are several Hyatt categories. But even comparing among Grand Hyatt, this hotel is better than other Grand Hyatt. Especially bathroom. Very big with separate shower and tub. Location is excellent as leisure tourists, I guess even for business travellers. The only thing I was disappointed was no bar or restaurant in a hotel.The only place to satisfy that is Ruth Chris Steak House in a hotel which is a fancy restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Property”
Reviews.Author: mwalno
Reviews.Content: I forgot what a SPECTACULAR property this is.......and what excellent service everyone provides. This is truly an excellent property!! Please see my blog at http://talesfromtheroad-mwalno.blogspot.com/ It began when I valet parked the car, the guy were all friendly and helpful. Next I moved to the registration desk and was helped by Katie. She was AWESOME, friendly, efficient and offered up some good local spots for dinner. Just what you want when you check in. Next, I headed up to the Regency Club to get some water and I met Alex. Great young kid who went out of his way to make me feel comfortable and help with directions and traffic to the airport. I had a note from Mark Stiebeling, the GM, and I called him to let him know how great the staff was and to thank him for the room I am in. He was friendly and I enjoyed our chat. I then headed to the 4th floor gym. It is excellent, clean/modern look, enough space with cardio, weight machines, and free weights. I always like a bench press, but that was the only thing missing. I also used Louise the concierge to book a reservation for dinner and she was very friendly and efficient. Excellent service!! Only thing that was below expectation was the maid service on Friday....I left early in the morning and when I returned at 3 pm the room was just as I left it....no maid service. I called down and they came in and emptied the trash and delivered fresh towels. The property was surprisingly busy on the weekend....the club level for breakfast had a busy crowd for breakfast and the gym was crowded every morning (someone said it was people on the cruises). Overall an exceptional experience and a wonderful place to stay. The staff is exceptional and the location is awesome -- right next to the shopping and a 15 minute walk to the fish market. In fact, I don't even think you need a car if you are staying downtown -- everything is a short walk or cab away. $169.15 a night, valet is $33 + 3.14 + 3.30 = $39.44 a night

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: chiggy
Reviews.Content: We had a great deal on this hotel with Priceline of $85 a night. When we checked in to the hotel, the front staff reminded us of dealing with Priceline, which was not too classy, we thought. The location was great. Very close to the center of Seattle downtown. The famous bathroom was great, although the bed was not too comfortable. As others complained, the walls do not have good insulation, so you can hear guests next rooms and upstairs, which was okay since we expected it. We stayed there for two nights. What was disappointing was our room was not cleaned on the second day. We contacted the front desk as soon as we found out our room was not cleaned. The cleaning was not done promptly and the bathroom was not entirely cleaned. Hair was not cleaned from the shower and the bathroom amenities were not additinally provided from the night before. We got two messages saying our "NO DISTURB" light was ON in our room. We know for sure we did not turn in on. We did not like the lame excuse at all. In the morning, we were going to try to make some coffee in the room to check the taste of the coffee. Then we realized there was no carraffe in the coffe machine. How do they expect us to make coffee?? Perhaps we got a room through Priceline. We were not treated right. But it is hard to believe this is Hyatt. We would never pay their asking price for this hotel. Over all, the hotel was okay, as long as we get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel And Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Marfak
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention at the Convention Center and stayed at the Hyatt. It is a very nice hotel; walking distance to everywhere. The room was smaller than I'd expected and the furnishings were a little dated. The staff were very nice; service was very crisp and friendly. But there were two annoyances: (a) the plumbing was such that you could hear people flushing their toilet and showering, and (b) the only restaurant in the hotel is a Ruth's Chris', which was nice but rather pricey for a quick breakfast. There is also a Starbucks but your breakfast choices there are rather limited and it was always packed. But as hotels go this was a solid 4 stars in my book. And the Red Sox were staying there so I got to ride up the elevator with Jason Bay and Dice K -- they look so young!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: 42forever
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend before an Alaskin Cruise to see the sights of Seattle. Arrived on a Friday via the Greyline Downtowner Bus. What a deal! Easy to find in the airport, only $11 a person and drop you off right in front of the Hotel! This was one of my points of considerations in choosing this hotel and it worked out great! Hotel was very clean, Staff was attentive and nice. At first entering the lobby, it has a very calm and modern feel with a coolness to it. Our room was on the east side on the 21st floor. Large jetted bathtub for the Mrs! The bathroom was large with lots of style and function. The bed was comfortable and overall a great room! the view was great of the east side of town even though it was not a western view. Easy walk to Pikes Market and the tram to the sky needle. Only a $18 taxi ride to the pier 66. Lots of places to eat dinner, grab a drink and relax. Vons on Pine, just across the street is a great place to have lunch or dinner outside and sample their beer. Breakfast stumped us, but we figured we could walk to Pikes market easy enough to be there to enjoy the food there. Do not go to the Olive 8 breakfast - mediocre at best and $$$! Did not make it to the hot tub or workout room - but heard from others it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: Bandlady
Reviews.Content: We would definitely agree with all of the previous reviews - the Grand Hyatt is a wonderful place to stay in Seattle. From check-in to check-out we were completely pleased. Before our cruise we had a corner suite, which was spacious and spotless. Yes, the bathroom was huge! The bedroom is separated from the hallway by the sitting room, so it is very quiet. When we returned to Seattle after our cruise we had again reserved a corner suite. We arrived at the hotel very early (about 9:45AM), and there were no corner suites ready, which we had expected. However, Ryan at the front desk was determined to put us in a room right away, and he offered us a corner king at a much lower rate than the suite. This room was almost identical to the suite, except that the entranceway was a little smaller, and it was just as impressive! (For both of our stays we got very low rates with our AAA card.) Everyone we came in contact with was extremely professional and friendly. Special kudos go to Amanda and Ryan at the front desk, and Louise, the concierge, who was able to get us a table at the Sky City restaurant at the Space Needle after we had been told on the phone that there were no tables available! We will definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again if we ever return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: yellow1NewJersey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is updated and the rooms are very zen. Very clean and generally quiet, except for the shower plumbing. Unfortunately, I could hear whenever our neighbors took a shower, at 1:30AM, or 4:30AM. Everything else was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff made me feel like a VIP, even though the NY Yankees were staying there also.”
Reviews.Author: boltontravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband, 19m/o son and myself stayed here for a week. The service was so impressive. They go out of their way to make you feel special. I have stayed at tons of hotels and this definitely ranks way up there. We all felt the staff went out of their way to accomodate us. The only negative would be the concierge (sp?), who was not always available, and then a bit condiscending (sp?) with responses. The room was very clean and the bathroom very spacious and new.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - friendly staff - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lisaonthegoco
Reviews.Content: We came off a week long cruise on a Friday morning and arrived at 9:30am expecting to have to check our luggage. Surprise - the gentleman at the front desk moved rooms around and checked us in! We were staying on my husband's business points for 4 days. Hyatt knows how to treat it's points customers right unlike that other big "H" chain where we find ourselves in the worst rooms they have. This was an 18th floor room with a view towards the space needle. We had a room with 2 full beds but it worked as our 21 year old daughter was with us. We did place a towel in front of the door one night as some hallway noise was coming under the door but it seemed to be related to all the Baseball Fans staying at the hotel and arriving back at once. The bathroom had great amenities, a soaking tub and a spotless glass shower. The safe in the closet accomodated the laptop computer and we had plenty of hangers. The dresser was a little small since it accomodates the mini-bar. Right after check in someone knocked and asked if we had everythng we needed and she was very friendly. The doormen were knowledgeable and gave us good directions and information on the area. The Starbucks just outside the lobby was slow as molasses but friendly just not efficient! The Grayline bus to the airport leaves at 15 to and 15 after the hour from the west side of the hotel. This was a very good location as we went to ACT theater one night, walked over and back to Pikes Place Market another and to the Seattle Art Museum. Several malls are also close by with Food Courts.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been nicer!”
Reviews.Author: JustYourAverageJoe
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up to the hotel, we were more than thrilled with the customer service. The nice girl at the front desk (Amanda?) was so sweet. When the hotel found out we were celebrating my sister's 40th, they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine. The bellman (whose name escapes me) was a DOLL! He was hysterical and went out of his way to say hi to us when he saw us in the lobby over the weekend. If we needed anything, bam, it was provided. We stayed in the 1 bdrm suite and they brought up 2 rollaway beds for us (to accommodate the 4 of us) and it was perfect. My sister was in awe of the beautiful bathroom! =D The only drawback was that you had to pay $10/day for wireless. Seems odd when you could literally walk into the lobby at get it for free at Starbucks. Oh well. Would definitely give it two big thumbs up! (By the way, it was on the same block as the Cheesecake Factory and right down the street from lots of stores - PERFECT location!)

Reviews.Title: “It's all about marketing”
Reviews.Author: chiliyo
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay a this hotel when promised a 'corner room' and access to the Club Lounge 'with the best views of Seattle' . The corner rooms were not available when we checked in and the Club Lounge faces a buiding above the Convention center. Not much of a view. The rooms are decent size and clean but the Club Lounge is definitely too small for the number of rooms that have access to it . The was attended at all times by a solo young lady who did her best to keep up with the guests demands at peak hours (bkfst/evening). The beer/wine/spirits in the evening are US$4.00 a pop when as a rule of thumb Club Lounges offer them complimentary for two or three hours. They have a charge to use Internet in the room as well ... Would look for other hotels if go back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant pampering”
Reviews.Author: cobblehill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive suite at the Grand Hyatt last week and it was fantastic. They brought up two roll-away beds for our kids (who had their own bathroom), because the kids preferred them to the pull-out couch. We had a beautiful master bedroom with a lovely, spacious bathroom. The suite had a bar, lots of closets, an Ipod base, and lots of other amenities. The view from the 29th floor was amazing. It really couldn't have been better. The service was terrific, they were very nice to our rowdy children, and we felt completely taken care of and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect End to a Perfect Road Trip Around Washington/Oregon”
Reviews.Author: freshfields98
Reviews.Content: Stay here the last two nights of our Road Trip and it was a wise choice. Had room 2215 on the 22nd floor a corner room with great views. Everything was fantastic. Felt right at home as we had the Everton Football Team staying at the same time. The hotel position was great within walking distance of everywhere. We even walked 1 block to the train to get to the airport at a cost of $2.50 each. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: PAJAY
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel on our vacation as we passed through SEattle. This was definitely one of the top hotels we've ever stayed in. Absolutely 5 star in every sense of the word. Gorgeous rooms, staff extremely attentive. A quick example - while doing on line check-in for our flight in the main lobby, my daughter coughed once. A staff member came over to her with a cup of water. Whenever we return, we will positively stay at the Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: eslteach
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at The Grand Hyatt in Seattle for a few days before our son's wedding at Mt. Ranier. We were on the 27th floor in a corner suite with a lovely view. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The bed was great as were the amenities. The service was excellent. We treated ourselves to room service one morning and we couldn't have had a better experience. Our daughter and our niece stayed in a separate king bedroom and that also had a nice view. The bathrooms were large with separate shower and bath. We would definitely recommend the Emerald Suite. Everybody we came into contact with was extremely helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: j0yrenee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights based on TripAdvisor reviews - and am so glad that I did. I paid government rates for a fabulous room on the 14th floor that was whisper quiet and very roomy. I loved the special pushbutton room-darkening shade - wow, wish I had one at home! There were special touches throughout my room - beautiful stone light fixtures, artistic lighting - that provided a low-key, zen-like atmosphere. I worked out everyday and loved the health club facilities - chilled towels, headsets, filtered water - but especially prized the ability to watch a TV within the treadmill. The Starbucks within the hotel had the friendliest staff I've ever encountered - I found myself going every morning and every night to my new best friends :-) They recommended coffee and peppermint tea for my upset stomach - and it worked. I had the feeling that they really cared - a rare impression for a business traveller. I walked to Pike's Market, Nordstrom's, Sephora's and a great seafood restaurant - easy walk. The only drawback that I noted, common with many of the other hotels that I compared this one against, was that I had to pay for internet access. Finding a budget breakfast nearby was also not easy, so I ordered room service - hey, why not treat yourself sometimes? There is also a Ruth Chris Steak House on the premises, but I did not visit them this time - maybe next time?

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing place.”
Reviews.Author: HappyScotGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks and found the hotel to be a good base for our holiday in Seattle. The room was very nice and we had a good view from the 25th floor. The bathroom was huge with a lovely walk -in shower. I think that the restaurant was a bit expensive but there were good dining alternatives in the area. We used the Starbucks in the hotel and the staff were very nice there. At the hotel reception the staff were very nice and it was good that we could convert travellers cheques into cash there. However the second time we went we were told that the daily limit was $100 per day. I don`t think we managed to only spend $100 per day while in Seattle! :-) There were a number of conferences at the hotel and that gives the reception areas quite a busy atmosphere. The porters are always on hand to assist and they were really nice. The hotel is in a good location and we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Tashakane
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Grand Hyatt. We stayed in a suite on the 28th floor with a beautiful view overlooking the city of Seattle. I would definitely recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a wonderful hotel to begin and end a vacation at”
Reviews.Author: MGRHIlton
Reviews.Content: I have never traveled to Seattle, but decided to take a cruise out of their beautiful port to Alaska. We arrived at the Grand Hyatt a day early to ensure that we arrived on time for the cruise and when we returned from the cruise we decided to stay over the July 4th weekend. The staff at the Hyatt were some of the nicest people we encountered in Seattle. The front office staff and the concierge were all 10's, they remembered all of our names each time we went to the desk for anything. They were helpful, efficient and happy. The rooms were nicely appointed, spotless and clean. The hotel is within walking distance of just about every attraction in Seattle, if not it was a cheap cab ride to the event. They have Ruth's Chris inside the hotel, wow what a place to have breakfast much less dinner. am in the business and run a 1600 room competitors hotel in another city. I have never written a review before, but thought they deserved the accolades. The GM should be proud. The only suggestion I have is for them to provide transportation to the Cruise Ship Terminal

Reviews.Title: “Better than a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: calvino
Reviews.Content: My conference was at the hotel. I was thinking of saving a little cash (not so very much) by staying nearby, but decided to go for it. And I'm glad I did. This is the nicest Hyatt I've ever been in. All the fixtures are of the highest quality -- marble bathrooms hard wood furniture, Toto plumbing, etc. (even in the public areas) -- that it just plain makes you feel good to be there. Two tips: Use Seattle buses to get around. The 194 goes from Westlake (two blocks west on Pine) even the airport, and gets there in 35 minutes. It's the fastest way to get around! Plus, it's $2 -- just bring two singles on to the bus and pay there. I liked everything about the Ruth's Chris, which is the Hyatt's restaurant. I also really liked Wild Ginger, a couple of blocks away at 3rd & Union. Keep away from Morton's on 6th.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in good location”
Reviews.Author: Todnick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for five nights at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle. Upon arrival, we were met immediately by a bell captain and valet for parking. There didn't appear to be better choices for parking in the immediate vicinity, so we had to pay the parking fees. We arrived at check-in time so there was no problem getting our room right away. We were on the 24th floor with a beautiful view of the city down to the sound. The room was good size with a king bed, flat screen TV, desk, chair and ottoman. Floor to ceiling windows made the room seem larger. They had automatic window treatments for either letting in or blocking out light as needed. To me what really made the room was the enormous bathroom with separate soaking tub and shower plus a large vanity for putting out our belongings. They also provided robes and nice toiletries (including toothpaste which was a nice touch). There is a mini-fridge, but it's filled with items for purchase, so it's hard to use. They offer to bring up a small refrigerator for a $5 fee. I don't know where we would have put it. It would've been nice to have another chair in the room for lounging and reading. Otheriwse, one of us was always relegated to the bed for reading, which I found uncomfortable after awhile. We used the concierge and found his information to be a bit wanting. He directed us to a local laundry, which proved to be a long walk for nothing. We used the map they gave us after that to find out where things were, as well as the Internet. I did get free Internet as I'm a Platinum member, but I agree with others that it should probably be provided given the cost of the rooms. On a bit of a sour note, we were held up for quite some time when we went to check out. We had prepaid for the room, but were charged again. It took them some time to figure out how to back the charges off our credit card. The Pike St Market is a must-see, but try to go during the week. The weekends are crazy with masses of people moving through the market. The Music museum and Musem of Flight were really worthwhile; I recommend both. Vonn's restaurant (next door to the Hyatt) was a big disappointment....try something else. There's a great crepe place around the corner under the arch for both sweet and savory crepes made right in front of you. A few bumps at the Hyatt, but still a fun trip....loved Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel---you won't be disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl38
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the 4th of July weekend with my boyfriend. We just went for sightseeing and to relax. The staff was very friendly and helpful in guiding us to different bars/restaurants in the area. The location of this hotel is perfect--within walking distance to the Space Needle, Pikes Place, and the ocean front. The hotel room itself was immaculately clean and had a very upscale feel to it. Decorations were modern--including electronic room darkening shades, a large bathtub and shower, and flat screen TV. We didn't have a chance to check out the pool/spa area or fitness center--there's too much to do in Seattle to stay inside!! The only downside...? No free Wi-Fi connection. That aside, I will definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally misses the point”
Reviews.Author: Boplanman
Reviews.Content: Great location nice room if you don't mine running next door to star bucks to get Internet access. You'd think a 300 dollar a night hotel would include Internet access. Hell, Motel 6 does even that.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Seattle a day early to enjoy the town before departing on our Alaskan Cruise on the Celebrity Infinity and decided to stay a day over when we returned from the cruise We arrived before check in but that was no problem since I have a Hyatt Gold Card. I asked for an upgrade and was upgraded to a corner suite with a great view. The front desk and the bell desk are truly good at their customer service. Each person with whom we conversed called us by name the next time they saw us. One of the bell staff that stood out was Jazz. He was friendly and knew the area quite well also. The concierge at this hotel is fantastic. especially Scott. His directions and recommendations for food were on point each time we spoke. Check out was smooth and easy on the first day. When we returned to the hotel after the cruise, we encounted the same type of fabulous service we received the first time we were there. We were upgraded to a room with a wonderful view on the 24th floor. And the entire staff was courteious and gracious. The hotel is located within walking distance of great high end shops and boutiques. It is also within walking distance of Pikes Market. Be sure and look at this hotel when traveling to the Seattle area. I know if we travel that way again, the Grand Hyatt will get our business "hands down". Be sure not to confuse this one with the Hyatt over on Olive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Shopping and Seattle Sights”
Reviews.Author: lrmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt after going on an Alaskan NCL cruise. The location of this hotel is the great thing about it, right in the heart of the shopping area (Macys, Nordstroms, Abercrombie, American Eagle, Tiffanys, Old Navy etc etc), also good restaurants are right on your doorstep, plus a couple of cinemas. Its quite a "businessy" hotel, with various conferences/seminars going on, but this makes it a very stylish hotel. There is a Ruths Chris Steak House in the hotel and we went for dinner one night, great steaks in there (recommend blue cheese crusted one!). Also Starbucks is located in the hotel too, useful for breakfast in morning. Rooms are large and spacious, big flat screen TV, massive bed, coffee maker, large bathroom with great bath and wierd modern taps! Views are pretty good if you are on a high floor. Monorail for Seattle space needle is just down the road, and Pike Place Market within walking distance, we also visited the zoo and got the bus there which was free. Ask concierge for bus stop info, its only couple of blocks away, No 5 bus I think. Taxi would have been far more expensive. We also went to see the Mariners play baseball, great experience, something you have to do in America!! Overall I would recommend this hotel for its great location and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: natle81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It was in a great location to where you could walk to any major attraction downtown. The hotel was very clean and the prices were extremly reasonable. I would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: seniormrs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Even tho' we were on vacation (therefore never "dressed up") the staff, from bell hops, front desk, doormen, valet, etc. were the most courteous and welcoming folks we've EVER encountered in any of our many travels, including cruise ships. The level of training must be constant. The hotel is as grand as the "Grand" in its name; and the location perfect, but the most impressive of all was the unbelievable level of perceived warmth from everyone. Even tho' it would be a financial 'stretch' we'd return in a heartbeat if ever in Seattle again! No pool, but incredible fitness center and jacuzzi area

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous servcie and staff! Marvelous bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: KPoling
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fabulous. The staff was charming and extremely helpful. The hotel is lovely and is a great location near shopping and Pike Place Market. The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms were extraordinary! Meeting rooms were well equipped, with a comfortable temperature and reasonable seating. Even the conference food was good! Not your usual rubber chicken!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: trekkrsal
Reviews.Content: I spent three very peaceful nights at the Grand Hyatt. The room was large and extrordinarily clean. The bathroom had a large shower, and an inviting bathtub, that looked like new. The in-room coffee was the best "hotel room" coffee I have had in any hotel. And if you don't like the in-room coffee, a Starbucks is located next to the lobby. The bed and pillows were comfortable, but not as nice as the Marriott. The location can't be beat. It is next to the Convention Center, and a short walk to Pike Place and the Waterfront. Restaurants and shopping are near, including Nordstrom's and Nordstrom's Rack, Macy's, Barnes & Noble, and Coldwater Creek. A movie theater is across the street. My favorite places to go include "Ye Olde Curiosity Shoppe" at the Waterfront; the Underground Tour; and of course, Pike Place, where the original Starbuck's is located. If this is your first time to Seattle, I recommend the 3 hour city tour. It is a great overview of the city, and they take you to beautiful places for photos. The downside of the hotel, for me, was a stark and unappealing lobby, no gift shop for forgotten essentials, and no restaurant or bar area (however,Ruth's Chris Steak House is attached to the hotel.Too pricy for me.) So bundling up and going out in the freezing rain to get a cola or a snack was inconvenient. If you stay at this hotel, be prepared with your own snacks. This is not a place that would appeal to children. Overall, though, the staff went out of their way to make me comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It was off the hook!”
Reviews.Author: Happiness200
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was a dream.The hotel was clean and it made you feel at home.I also brought my boyfriend along and he loved the hotel.The people who work there were very nice and accomodating to us! I stayed a week and it was the most exhilerating experience at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: nyckt
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt in Seattle is top rate. From check-in to check-out it was a flawless stay. There was no line at check-in, and the attendant was extremely helpful, including putting us in a room on a higher floor at our request. We arrived at our room and were very pleased with the decor and the cleanliness. The bathroom is huge! There is plenty of room to spread out all of your toiletries on the counter. The shower has enough room for two! I called down to request more hangers, and in fewer than 5 minutes they were delivered. 30 seconds after the delivery our phone rang to inquire as to whether the hangers were "satisfactory for us". I couldn't believe how attentive the service was. The location is great, as it is one block from the convention center, near great shopping (Barney's, Tiffany's, etc.), and just a few blocks from the Pike's Place Market. It is about a 10 min. walk to Belltown, which is where a lot of great restaurants and bars are located. I recommend the Dahlia Lounge! It is also a few blocks to catch the monorail ($2 one-way) to go to the Seattle Center (Space Needle, Experience Music Project, etc.). I had colleagues staying at other hotels in the area that didn't seem nearly as nice as the Grand Hyatt. The only difficulty is getting from the airport to the hotel/downtown. It is about a $40 cab ride one-way. There is an $11 shuttle that comes every half hour. It is convenient, but takes a bit more time than a cab. There is a Ruth's Chris steakhouse in the hotel that we didn't try. The hotel also has kiosks in the lobby so that you can check in for your flight and print your boarding pass. We ordered fish from the Pike's Place Fish Market to take home. The fish company delivered it to the hotel and the hotel held it in the fridge until we were ready to take it. It was a perfect stay, and I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for location, quality, cleanliness, and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Normally out of my price range, but really nice!”
Reviews.Author: artygal
Reviews.Content: This was by far the most I have paid for a room for business ($200+valet). Having said that: I was comfortable, felt safe (woman traveling alone), loved how close I was to where I needed to be (the Convention Center). Door man was incredibly friendly, valet guys nice and relaxed (I'm 40, but not used to Ma'am, and young men holding doors open for me), front desk was gracious. For what you pay, you expect all that, but it also felt authentic, which was surprising and nice. Room was spacious, with a view of the water. Bathroom was huge, holy cow! Didn't feel the need to pay extra for the corner suite, got a discounted rate through AAA. Stayed 4 nights, could enter Starbucks from the lobby, and walk 1/2 block to the Convention Center. TV choices a was a bit on the small side, one premium channel?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location...impressive rooms....spectacular views...looking forward to coming back”
Reviews.Author: LisainAZ
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and the Grand Hyatt Seattle has one of the most beautiful bathrooms I've seen that are three times the size of most hotel bathrooms with spa like glass showers, luxurious bathroom fixtures from the faucets to the bathtub, and marble floors...perfect for honeymooners or the most meticulous travelers...the location was perfect..within walking distance to everything...no need for a rental car here..save your money for the great food in the area....the views from this hotel are also impeccible....I decided to watch the sunset from my hotel room as it had the best view in the city. While your in Seattle I would also highly recommend Bill Siegels Underground Tour - take the night tour...informative, fun, and a great way to discover Seattles history.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location,fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkyd2002
Reviews.Content: With large rooms, huge bathroom, great central location this really is a great hotel. Stayed here for 5 nights and have to say I loved the hotel. I will go back to Seattle again in the future and this is guaranteed to be wher I stay

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt. Not Grand.”
Reviews.Author: RonDunn
Reviews.Content: Only the staff saved this hotel from a "terrible" rating. At every contact they were friendly, efficient, and went out of their way to be helpful. So what went wrong? NOISE. Loud, banging, wall-shaking, sleep-destroying NOISE. Every room in this hotel has a gap under the door of at least 1cm of clear air, some much greater. That means every noise outside your room has a perfect method of entry. And every door in this hotel is very heavy, and automatically shut by a very strong door closer. Not just shut, but SLAMMED with a click-BANG-CLUNK which echoes around your room every time someone within six doors of you decides to go in or out. If you have the misfortune to get a room in a corner you have two doors immediately adjacent to your own, and your walls will shake when those doors close. What makes it worse is the oddest air conditioning design I've seen in a hotel room. The gap under the door supports air flow-through to an extraction vent on the far side of the room. It actually accelerates the flow of noise into the room. On the subject of air conditioning, it can't have the fan set to a constant white noise, it comes on and off at its own will. The next horror comes when you open the bar fridge. There is a special place in business traveller hell which is specially reserved for the person that invented the computerised bar fridge that automatically charges you when you move an item, and won't let you place your own items in that fridge. And that place is surrounded by mini torture chambers for any hotel GM cheap and nasty enough to put those instruments of the devil in any hotel pretending to be "Grand". Let's try to be positive for a moment. The room was nicely furnished. Comfortable bed and sitting chair, good sized desk, but a little spoiled by a "designer" chair making the wrong ratio between desk and buttocks. When will hotels learn? Save money and make happy business customers by getting rid of your fancy desk chairs and giving us a nice, simple, adjustable office chair! The television was a large flat screen with a good range of channels. There was an innovative drip-filter coffee machine of a type I've not seen before, but which worked very well to help me wake up each morning. The bathroom was a great size and everything worked well. But here we go again with the "not Grand" theme of this review. This hotel has the most hectoring anti-laundry policy I can remember. Not content with the typical, hypocritical "Save the environment, re-use your towels" we usually get, they extend it to making you telephone Housekeeping and actually ASK for your bed linen to be changed! And you only find this out if you notice a small card in the bathroom. No card to leave, you have to CALL and wait for them to answer, then beg for a little luxury in your life. I was there for 8 days, staying by myself, and I don't THINK the linen was automatically changed once in that time. Even if changed, the linen is too small for the size of the mattress, which means it doesn't tuck in on all sides, and you wake up in a crumpled, lumpy mess instead of a smooth sheeted bed. Let's move to the hotel facilities. A rhetorical question: how many "Grand" hotels don't have a buffet breakfast? This was the first in which I've stayed where only a limited a-la-carte breakfast was available to guests, served in the attached restaurant. As someone described in a recent review, this area doubles as the hotel bar, and is more like a cafeteria. Eminently forgettable. The further we move away from the core of the hotel, the poorer the facilities become. There used to be a gift shop. Empty. There used to be another restaurant. Abandoned. In fact, the general exterior of the hotel makes me wonder if it is beginning to suffer from an economic downturn in the area. The property needs to let those spaces to vibrant businesses to improve the ambience of the hotel! You know, I was trying to think of something good to say to wrap up the review, but I can't. Apart from the GREAT staff, already mentioned, there is nothing I saw in this hotel to justify its position in the Tripadvisor ratings. The next time I'm in Seattle I'll definitely stay elsewhere. There's a lot of work to be done to justify the name of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lovefur
Reviews.Content: Stark in comparison to older classier hotels in the neighborhood (downtown), but comfortable. Bar was like a cafeteria-don't bother! Not much decor, kinda boring appearance to guest room. On the plus side, I am a bed-fanatic and I liked the quality of the beds. Not quite like the Marriott or Sheraton sleeper, but very close. We had a room on high floor (25) so barely any noise from outside or from other rooms. Loved the automatic black out curtain! Great bathrobes but no hooks anywhere--not even in the bathroom for robes or coats or whatever. Coffee maker and minibar ok. Good flat screen tv but our remote didn't work the first night and was repaired the next day. Fitness area was open 24 hrs and had very modern weight equip. Suana, jacuzzi, and steam bath but no pool. All included w/price of room. Slightly better than average room service for breakfast one day. Room service NOT 24 hr.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: RushfanMI
Reviews.Content: When I travel for pleasure, I like to explore the city myself. That means I don't evaluate a hotel by the concierge or the staff - I just look for decent, unobtrusive service. I do, however, want a comfortable room. I want to be able to get lost in the city on foot, find a bunch of cool places I never expected, stagger back to the hotel, and feel like I've come home - only better. The Grand Hyatt delivered. Our suite was up on the 23rd floor, with incredible views of downtown and the waterfront. It was clean and very comfortable. I was a little surprised that I had to ask for a mini-fridge in a suite room, but when I asked, the desk had one in my room in less than five minutes. I was sad when we had to check out, and when I get to go back to Seattle, I'm going to try to plan my trip around getting that exact same room again. If there was a downside to our stay, it was only that the 23rd floor can give one an overly optimistic sense of how far away things are. We'd see things from our window that we wanted to visit, thinking they were nearby, only to find that on street level, it was quite a hike getting there.

Reviews.Title: “What a Magnificent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shastaball
Reviews.Content: This place really was great. We had a corner suite on the 24th floor affording a beautiful view of the Sound and downtown/Space Needle. Staff were extremely attentive and friendly, without being overbearing. The exercise/gym was fantastic for a hotel. Just the right amount of equipment (about 12 total high quality treadmills and elliptical plus full weight system) with built in TVs on each piece of equipment for personal viewing. They even had adequate work out gear for sale if you needed it (at reasonable prices) and rental Garmin HRM w/ GPS if you forgot yours. Ruth's Chris restaurant is on site and convenient, with the expected level of consistent quality from that chain. The location of this hotel is exceptional, with many things within walking distance or a short cab ride if you prefer. The room was spacious, extremely well appointed, clean and very quiet. The views were killer and worth more than the rate we paid. I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: MarshaMello
Reviews.Content: I chose the Grand Hyatt for my husband's birthday getaway based on Tripadvisor reviews and its location. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful -- we were cheerfully encouraged to check in early, my request for a an upper floor room was granted with a corner suite on the 30th (top) floor, and a complimentary bottle of wine was sent to us in honor of my husband's special day. The hotel is located in the shopping district, and is a short walk from Pike Place Market and the monorail to Seattle Center (the Space Needle). There are movie theaters and numerous restaurants nearby, and of course a Starbuck's in the lobby was very welcome. My only criticism, as noted by several other reviewers, relates to the furniture in "living area" of the suite. The arms of the chair and loveseat were very worn, and they weren't particularly comfortable (i.e., nothing you'd be tempted to curl up in while reading or watching TV). Not up to the standards I'd expect from a property with this star rating. (As an aside, can someone explain to me why Motel 6 and other low-end accommodations provide free internet access, but most luxury hotels -- the Grand Hyatt included -- want to charge me $10 per day?)

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: singtx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night at the end of our vacation after snowboarding. Would've stayed the W but they jacked up the rates. Check in was a breeze and they had my extra pillows ready for us. I think we were upgraded (not sure) but we had a great view of the bay and a slightly obstructed view of the Needle. I also stayed at the W seattle 4 nights (please see review). The gym was the largest I have ever seen with hot tub, sauna, and steam room. (My wife and I took advantage of all of them). Outstanding facilites. The restroom was huge with a tub and shower. Location is good but not the best. I agree with other reviewers that the Hyatt hasnt put any "Seattle" touches to the place. Overall good stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent but Overrated”
Reviews.Author: flygalaz
Reviews.Content: I decided to try this on a recent combo trip up to Seattle for business and to see friends. Since it was â€œhighlyâ€� rated by TripAdvisor Contributors I decided to give it a go. I have to say I was a â€œlittle disappointedâ€� from what I was expecting for a Grand Hyatt (their flagship property). By no means is this a â€œbad choiceâ€� so donâ€™t get me wrong, it really just depends on your likes and dislikes. Here is a summary of my experience and my opinion on this property: Location â€“ I give it a 50/50. Yes, you are semi-in the heart of downtown Seattle (but on the edge, close to the freeway). You are near shopping, businesses and the convention center BUT you are also close to the freeway so many of the rooms have â€œfreeway viewâ€�. My room/suite actually had a combo-freeway/water view (peek-a-boo on the water side)â€¦I honestly expected more water and less freeway for what I was paying. Now, you donâ€™t really hear the freeway too much but you do get to look at it depending on where your room is. For a comparable price, there are several hotels in the area with much better views that are much closer to the water and sites. Charm â€“ There is not much â€œcharmâ€� to this hotel but I donâ€™t know that is the objective either. Itâ€™s fairly corporate with clean lines but so many properties in downtown Seattle have special touches like wine tasting in the lobby, fireplaces in room, etc. where they really make it feel special (think the Monaco, or Mayflower or Vintage Park, etc.). Food - Well yes there is a Ruth Chris on property but while that is a nice high end place, itâ€™s a chain. Give me something with true â€œSeattleâ€� personality. Seattle is such a â€œfoodieâ€� town, I can go to Ruth Chris in any major city in the U.S. Rooms â€“ The best part is the bathroom in my opinion handâ€™s down. Spacious, modern, clean, etc. Sure thatâ€™s great, but how much are you really in there? The bedrooms while fairly standard for Hyatt and most the chains these days (comfortable beds, flatscreens, etc.) the furniture was a little worn. Some of my furniture had lots of nicks and scrapes. Additionally the "attractive leather" chair at the desk was not adjustable nor that comfortbale so I could not really utilize the desk in comfort as I could with an ergonomic chair many hotels provide these days. The bedroom portion of the room itself reminded me a bit of the size you find in NYC at a â€œWâ€� or something similar. There is not much area between the bed and wall/dressers so if two of you are trying to pass to get to the door or bath at the same time, it will be tight. Realistically that is not untypical for an urban hotel but in many of the Seattle downtown properties, they appear to be a bit more generous in the size of the bedroom itself (in this case, a decent amount of square footage goes to the bathroom). Perhaps it was just the layout or usage of the square footage but I was not that excited about it. Gym â€“ Well I am always fairly happy with the Hyatt facilities for their gym and one of the reasons I come back. Maintaining a workout on the road is important to me and they are always well equipped, clean and spacious and are more like a real â€œgymâ€� than just a small â€œfitness roomâ€� that many properties offer. All that being said, I probably wonâ€™t come back to this particular Hyatt. I think Seattle has a lot more â€œinterestingâ€� properties in this price range and location with special touches you just donâ€™t get at the larger corporate chains. Ahhhâ€¦.consistent but boring.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: clifton2a
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again while visiting family over Thanksgiving and it's still my favourite in Seattle the staff are great and very friendly especially David who couldn't do enough for us. I think the views are the best straight down Pine to the Market & Water and from the side out over to the Space needle which my young Son loved Great location for shopping and some nice restaraunts close by also

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: StuffAndStuff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stellar! Room was updated and contemporary. We stayed in a corner suite and loved the view and layout. Front desk was very friendly and well-staffed (I am not the most patient person). Food was good at the steakhouse in the lobby and of course the lobby Starbucks was definitely convenient. We went to an event at the Paramount Theater, which was just across the street and shopping was around the corner. Oh, and we arrived several hours before check-in, so of course the room wasn't ready. But the front desk rushed the cleaning and called me on my cell phone as soon as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rogjaminov
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this hotel for a fun weekend away. I usually have good luck with hotels in Seattle, but this place is phenomenal. Not only is it modern and very comfortable (the beds are incredible), but the location can't be beat. It's right in the heart of the shopping district downtown and there are plenty of great restaurants nearby (try the Metropolitan Grill for happy hour). The room we stayed in had electric blinds that virtually black out the room, so you won't be woken up by the light creeping through the curtains. And when you eventually wake up, naturally there's a Starbucks in the lobby. I've stayed in some good hotels in Seattle, but I'll return to the Hyatt next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: milboj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights when in Seattle for a wedding. After a 30+ hour trip from Australia it was heaven. The bed was huge and comfy, the bathroom beautiful and the staff really helpful and friendly. The room was very clean, and linen and towels changed daily. Not the mention the great location... If ever in Seattle do not hesitate to stay here or recommend it to someone else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent center city hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyWeekender
Reviews.Content: A beautiful centrally-located hotel in downtown Seattle. Has a modern norhwest contemporary feel with use of beautiful wood paneling, furntiure, and natural colors. The rooms are spacious, each with a with plasma TV and extra large marble bathroom. All rooms are floors 10-28, so I assume that all have excellent views. Located within a couple blocks of excellent shopping, restaurants, and theaters. Pike Place market about 7 blocks west. Vicinty of hotel is a comfortable area to walk during the day and evening hours. The new hotel fitness center is spacious, has modern new equipment, and its mirrored walls and beautiful wood paneling throughout give it a rich and spacious feel..
