Reviews.Content: Great Hotel but let the nitpicking begin.... Construction is underway outside the hotel front and naturally we got a room facing that side. Luckily minimal impact as we were out all day, but consider that issue. Downtown Seattle must be ridden with police cruisers since I counted a least a half dozen sirens heard thoughout the first night, hey it was Friday so who can say? Rooms have gigantic bathrooms. Beds are pillowtopped on steroids. So much so that if you sleep anywere other than middle of the bed you will feel like you will fall off. Also any movement by one partner will result in jello like quivering of the bed which my wife certainly did not enjoy. Had room service which was really tasty and hot. Chili is great! Only restaurant in the hotel is Ruths Chris which is awesome to satisfy any carnivore but probably vegans will have to just get steamed broccoli. Kids were welcome and the staff was very nice. Weird that the hotel really doesn't have a lounge unless you count the Ruth's, and Ruths is not a place I usually go for a drink. Luckily the hotel across the street has a nice bar. Close to all the shops. If you want to shop this is the place to use as your base of ops. If you are a groupie the Cleveland Indians stayed here our weekend. Gym is nice but strange, huge machine area but lots of wasted space. Minimal weight equipment but it is very modern nice stuff. Great house staff, appropriate level of care and attentiveness. Belllguys remembered my kids all weekend and were super nice to them. (Did not see a lot of kids in this place however). Valet guys are great. All in all a great weekend and would stay here again. Wife wishes they had a pool and a proper lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent an evening at the Grand Hyatt and we were absolutely impressed with the service and restraunts. Arrived late in the evening and immediately went to dinner after check in. Our bags and a roll away bed were in our room when we returned. Upgraded our room to a suite on the 30th floor. Room was immaculate with an excellent view. King bed was very comfortable and the linen soft. Very large bathroom and sitting room. Several restraunts, Ruth's Cris & Cheese Cake Factory, minutes from the hotel. GrayLine airport shuttle stops right at the hotel which is very convienent. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth more than we paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a massive 28th floor suite for $240. It had views of everything, had an enormous bathroom, and even had a foyeur of sorts. The only disappointment is the restaurant connected with the hotel: Ruth's Chris Steaks. We ate breakfast there and service was pitiful. But big deal. We'll eat breakfast somewhere else next time. Location is perfect, service was good, suite was a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on a weekend getaway to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary. Our standard room was upgraded to a suite, and it was beautiful! Everything was very luxurious and the service was outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience a real 5 star hotel. The location was perfect (close to shopping local attractions, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: socal4na
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for a quick weekend getaway just before Christmas. The location is great, the rooms are outstanding, restaurant and bar - excellent. Very, very nice. The parking is outrageously priced, so I would look for a nearby alternative (the pay lot across the stree). We loved our stay and only wish it was longer.

Reviews.Title: “A truly outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMNWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Thanksgiving weekend for our wedding anniversary. We booked a "corner suite" and were upgraded to an "executive suite." The room was spectacular. We had a view of the Sound, downtown, and the Space Needle. We had a great view for the fireworks and celebration when they lit the Christmas tree downtown. The room was incredibly large - actually it was several rooms. The executive suite includes a large living room, wet bar, powder room, bedroom, dressing room, and huge bathroom. It had luxurious furnishings in that low key, classy Northwest style. The service was great and everyone at the front desk was great. Breakfast in the restaurant hotel (727 Pine) was great, as was the service. We had drinks there several nights and they were great too. This would definitely be my first choice for a hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “If you can find a good rate - the best place to stay in town, no question”
Reviews.Author: KevinSdammit
Reviews.Content: Newly revamped hotel -maybe 2yrs ago. Took an older historic hotel, upgraded it, and it's easily one of the nicest properties in Seattle. I stayed there maybe 10 times over the last 2yrs, and finally had to stop when their continued price increases pushed them outside of my business budget :( The corner suites are phenomenal. Like a small apartment. First class hotel, lovely, very modern almost 'W' feel. I LOVED the bed, contrary to the one guy who wrote in - slept like a baby. Great location, right downtown, can't beat it. If you can find a good rate - the best place to stay in town, no question

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable weekend stay...”
Reviews.Author: atcken
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick labor day weekend trip to Seattle. After reading reviews here and finding a AAA rate (with breakfast) for a corner suite of $198.00 per night, my wife and I decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt. I called to confirm before our trip and requested a high floor with views of the waterfront. The Hyatt national reservation desk, where I was routed, was helpful and checked with the hotel directly for availability. After a little wait, the Hyatt reservation agent advised that we could get a high floor with the view we requested but they couldn't confirm until later. The agent promised to call my cell phone, even if she had to stay a bit late (we didn't arrive until near midnight). I was surprised to get a call back as promised with a confirmation of the room and room number. Check in was smooth as we had confirmed via telephone. Our room was exactly as promised - great view of both downtown Seattle (Needle and all) and a view towards Pike Place Market and the waterfront. Comfortable king bed with down pillow top bedding on the mattress. Remote controlled shades on the windows. Very luxurious bathroom with large shower and tub. All amenities including professional hair dryer, iron and board, in room safe, 2 TVs, complimentary umbrella, coffee maker, and plush robes (for use in room - or to purchase for taking home - $50 per robe). Did I mention the views? Wow! Hotel location was fine - corner of 7th and Pine so the walk to the waterfront was about 8 blocks. Very near excellent shopping and the Westlake Shopping Center. We had breakfast in the fine restaurant (727 Pine) each morning. The only knock I have against this hotel is the prices for the meals - although we didn't have to pay for breakfast as it was part of the package. Examples - $13 omelettes, $12 for salmon appetizers, $12 for waffles. We didn't check the dinner menu as we assumed the prices were much more for that meal and we had already planned to eat at the waterfront (which was actually reasonable and great views) and on Bainbridge Island. All in all, nice hotel - great amenities, decent location, taxis in front almost constantly if you chose that method of transportation, and again, the views from the hotel were incredible. Starbucks on the bottom floor. Didn't check out the fitness area or spa but these are supposed to be excellent. We'd recommend this hotel for a nice downtown stay in Seattle - call ahead for telephone confirmation to know your room number before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a workshop over Memorial Day weekend. Almost all the staff members I came into contact with were very friendly. The gentleman that was at the front desk when I checked in addressed me by my name each time he saw me throughout my stay. I found the other personnel very helpful. When I walked into the hotel room I immediately felt I was in a special place. The entrance immediately set the tone for the rest of the room. I had a great view of the water and mountains from my room. The bathroom was large with an oversized tub and a stand alone shower. The Hyatt will be my first choice for accomodations when I make my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing short of magnificent! Located in a prime retail and business corridor, the Grand Hyatt spoiled us from the moment we walked through the front door. We happened to arrive during the Women's NCAA Basketball Tournament and found the hotel very busy. When they were unable to accommodate our original request of 2 double beds, they upgraded us to a 30th floor suite! The room was outstanding and my 2 sons were mesmerized by the view. The staff was exceptional and we hated to leave. Next trip to Seattle will definitely include the Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “The best in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a pleasure staying at this hotel. We were VERY fortunate to priceline this hotel at a remarkably inexpensive rate. The service was first class our entire stay, from the bellmen to the front desk to housekeeping. We were upgraded to a junior suite at check-in, with a priceline reservation! The room was outstanding...bathroom was out of this world for a hotel. The automatic blinds made it nice to wake up in the morning and raise the blinds as you lay in bed. This is a great hotel, worth whatever you spend!

Reviews.Title: “. . this hotel is as good as it gets !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This city hotel --Grand Hyatt, Seattle-- is as good as it gets ! Beautifully equipped room and bath, with lovely linens and superb lighting fixtures; excellent and efficient in-room dining service; responsive front desk; plus, best business service office ever encountered ! This hotel is a haven of tranquility, service, and amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of this hotel is well-thought out and gorgeous. You know it's really something when the faucet in the bathtub is impressive -- or how about the shades that open to reveal a magnificent view simply by hitting a button next to your bed? The staff is very friendly and helpful, and room service is yummy. The rooms are a tad small, but how beautifully the rooms are appointed makes you forget that very quickly. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! Very chic and updated. Loved it. The food at 727 Pine is out of this world. The gym was great, the sauna was relaxing, the hot tub was serene. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently made a trip to Seattle with my mother to meet family coming from overseas. I had hoped to stay at the Westin -- which I've stayed at several times on business trips, always with a good experience -- but they were booked for the dates I wanted. After reading the reviews here and elsewhere, I thought the Elliott would be a good substitute. Wrong! At check-in I was informed that I had been given a suite as free upgrade over the standard 2-bed room that I had reserved. Imagine my surprise when I got to the suite, only to discover that it had only one bed... Mom was not cool with the idea either. After a lengthy wait at the front desk, I was told that there were no rooms with 2 beds available at the moment (in spite of my having reserved exactly that), and they would try to find one for me. I was invited to wait in the suite until a room was found. Well over an hour later, with no call from the desk, I went back downstairs only to discover that the clerk who had spoken with me earlier had gone off duty for the day. Nobody knew anything about my previous discussion and I had to start all over again explaining how I was still waiting for the room I had reserved weeks earlier. We finally got a room, after three hours' unnecessary waiting. Other than that, the decor is impressive but austere, and the restaurant is more style than substance (with air conditioning at meat-locker levels). I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Escaped to the Elliott Hotel Seattle”
Reviews.Author: paulclark
Reviews.Content: The Elliott Seattle was booked for me by my travel agent because I wanted a central hotel for my holiday that was 'tasty'. What we experienced was a hotel of total privacy in the centre of a vibrant city, and with sumptuous surroundings to go with it. The view from our bedroom, just electronically slide up those shutters to peep at the day, was pure Seattle. At night the view was even better. A policy of charging corkage for personal drinks enjoyed in the room seemed a corporate intrusion that had to be dealt with, and I would recommend that the management reconsider that policy. Nonetheless the experience was excellent; five out of five, and could get into the top rank of individual chain hotels if it became a bit less business orientated. Sincerely, Paul Clark

Reviews.Title: “I was a special guest”
Reviews.Author: LisaMSandyUT
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in, I was made to feel like a special guest even though I had acquired an online rate that was better than most chain hotels. The front desk staff were friendly, the room service staff efficient, even pouring my coffee before leaving. The rooms were large and luxurious, with a nice big shower AND tub. Having Starbuck's practically in the hotel was nice, and the area is near lots of shopping and a Cheesecake Factory! Right down to the doorman fetching me a taxi on my departure, I was a VIP in every way. Would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hyatt Seattle
HotelInfo.Address: 721 Pine Street, Seattle, WA 98101
